   11257          56 :         ObjectAddressSet(obj, RelationRelationId, oldId);
   11258          56 :         add_exact_object_address(&obj, objects);
   11259             :     }
   11260             : 
   11261             :     /*
   11262             :      * It should be okay to use DROP_RESTRICT here, since nothing else should
   11263             :      * be depending on these objects.
   11264             :      */
   11265         210 :     performMultipleDeletions(objects, DROP_RESTRICT, PERFORM_DELETION_INTERNAL);
   11266             : 
   11267         210 :     free_object_addresses(objects);
   11268             : 
   11269             :     /*
   11270             :      * The objects will get recreated during subsequent passes over the work
   11271             :      * queue.
   11272             :      */
   11273         210 : }
   11274             : 
   11275             : /*
   11276             :  * Parse the previously-saved definition string for a constraint or index
   11277             :  * against the newly-established column data type(s), and queue up the
   11278             :  * resulting command parsetrees for execution.
   11279             :  *
   11280             :  * This might fail if, for example, you have a WHERE clause that uses an
   11281             :  * operator that's not available for the new column type.
   11282             :  */
   11283             : static void
   11284         144 : ATPostAlterTypeParse(Oid oldId, Oid oldRelId, Oid refRelId, char *cmd,
   11285             :                      List **wqueue, LOCKMODE lockmode, bool rewrite)
   11286             : {
   11287             :     List       *raw_parsetree_list;
   11288             :     List       *querytree_list;
   11289             :     ListCell   *list_item;
   11290             :     Relation    rel;
   11291             : 
   11292             :     /*
   11293             :      * We expect that we will get only ALTER TABLE and CREATE INDEX
   11294             :      * statements. Hence, there is no need to pass them through
   11295             :      * parse_analyze() or the rewriter, but instead we need to pass them
   11296             :      * through parse_utilcmd.c to make them ready for execution.
   11297             :      */
   11298         144 :     raw_parsetree_list = raw_parser(cmd);
   11299         144 :     querytree_list = NIL;
   11300         288 :     foreach(list_item, raw_parsetree_list)
   11301             :     {
   11302         144 :         RawStmt    *rs = lfirst_node(RawStmt, list_item);
   11303         144 :         Node       *stmt = rs->stmt;
   11304             : 
   11305         144 :         if (IsA(stmt, IndexStmt))
   11306          56 :             querytree_list = lappend(querytree_list,
   11307          56 :                                      transformIndexStmt(oldRelId,
   11308             :                                                         (IndexStmt *) stmt,
   11309             :                                                         cmd));
   11310          88 :         else if (IsA(stmt, AlterTableStmt))
   11311          84 :             querytree_list = list_concat(querytree_list,
   11312          84 :                                          transformAlterTableStmt(oldRelId,
   11313             :                                                                  (AlterTableStmt *) stmt,
   11314             :                                                                  cmd));
   11315             :         else
   11316           4 :             querytree_list = lappend(querytree_list, stmt);
   11317             :     }
   11318             : 
   11319             :     /* Caller should already have acquired whatever lock we need. */
   11320         144 :     rel = relation_open(oldRelId, NoLock);
   11321             : 
   11322             :     /*
   11323             :      * Attach each generated command to the proper place in the work queue.
   11324             :      * Note this could result in creation of entirely new work-queue entries.
   11325             :      *
   11326             :      * Also note that we have to tweak the command subtypes, because it turns
   11327             :      * out that re-creation of indexes and constraints has to act a bit
   11328             :      * differently from initial creation.
   11329             :      */
   11330         288 :     foreach(list_item, querytree_list)
   11331             :     {
   11332         144 :         Node       *stm = (Node *) lfirst(list_item);
   11333             :         AlteredTableInfo *tab;
   11334             : 
   11335         144 :         tab = ATGetQueueEntry(wqueue, rel);
   11336             : 
   11337         144 :         if (IsA(stm, IndexStmt))
   11338             :         {
   11339          56 :             IndexStmt  *stmt = (IndexStmt *) stm;
   11340             :             AlterTableCmd *newcmd;
   11341             : 
   11342          56 :             if (!rewrite)
   11343          18 :                 TryReuseIndex(oldId, stmt);
   11344          56 :             stmt->reset_default_tblspc = true;
   11345             :             /* keep the index's comment */
   11346          56 :             stmt->idxcomment = GetComment(oldId, RelationRelationId, 0);
   11347             : 
   11348          56 :             newcmd = makeNode(AlterTableCmd);
   11349          56 :             newcmd->subtype = AT_ReAddIndex;
   11350          56 :             newcmd->def = (Node *) stmt;
   11351          56 :             tab->subcmds[AT_PASS_OLD_INDEX] =

   11353             :         }

   11461             : /*
   11462             :  * Subroutine for ATPostAlterTypeParse() to recreate any existing comment
   11463             :  * for a table or domain constraint that is being rebuilt.
   11464             :  *

   11466             :  * Pass "rel" for a table constraint, or "domname" (domain's qualified name
   11467             :  * as a string list) for a domain constraint.

   11686             : 
   11687             : /*
   11688             :  * ALTER TABLE OWNER
   11689             :  *
   11690             :  * recursing is true if we are recursing from a table to its indexes,
   11691             :  * sequences, or toast table.  We don't allow the ownership of those things to
   11692             :  * be changed separately from the parent table.  Also, we can skip permission
   11693             :  * checks (this is necessary not just an optimization, else we'd fail to
   11694             :  * handle toast tables properly).
   11695             :  *
   11696             :  * recursing is also true if ALTER TYPE OWNER is calling us to fix up a
   11697             :  * free-standing composite type.
   11698             :  */
   11699             : void
   11700          76 : ATExecChangeOwner(Oid relationOid, Oid newOwnerId, bool recursing, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   11701             : {
   11702             :     Relation    target_rel;
   11703             :     Relation    class_rel;
   11704             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   11705             :     Form_pg_class tuple_class;
   11706             : 
   11707             :     /*
   11708             :      * Get exclusive lock till end of transaction on the target table. Use
   11709             :      * relation_open so that we can work on indexes and sequences.
   11710             :      */
   11711          76 :     target_rel = relation_open(relationOid, lockmode);
   11712             : 
   11713             :     /* Get its pg_class tuple, too */
   11714          76 :     class_rel = table_open(RelationRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   11715             : 
   11716          76 :     tuple = SearchSysCache1(RELOID, ObjectIdGetDatum(relationOid));
   11717          76 :     if (!HeapTupleIsValid(tuple))
   11718           0 :         elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for relation %u", relationOid);
   11719          76 :     tuple_class = (Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   11720             : 
   11721             :     /* Can we change the ownership of this tuple? */
   11722          76 :     switch (tuple_class->relkind)
   11723             :     {
   11724             :         case RELKIND_RELATION:
   11725             :         case RELKIND_VIEW:
   11726             :         case RELKIND_MATVIEW:
   11727             :         case RELKIND_FOREIGN_TABLE:
   11728             :         case RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE:
   11729             :             /* ok to change owner */
   11730          34 :             break;
   11731             :         case RELKIND_INDEX:
   11732          20 :             if (!recursing)
   11733             :             {
   11734             :                 /*
   11735             :                  * Because ALTER INDEX OWNER used to be allowed, and in fact
   11736             :                  * is generated by old versions of pg_dump, we give a warning
   11737             :                  * and do nothing rather than erroring out.  Also, to avoid
   11738             :                  * unnecessary chatter while restoring those old dumps, say
   11739             :                  * nothing at all if the command would be a no-op anyway.
   11740             :                  */
   11741           0 :                 if (tuple_class->relowner != newOwnerId)
   11742           0 :                     ereport(WARNING,
   11743             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   11744             :                              errmsg("cannot change owner of index \"%s\"",
   11745             :                                     NameStr(tuple_class->relname)),
   11746             :                              errhint("Change the ownership of the index's table, instead.")));
   11747             :                 /* quick hack to exit via the no-op path */
   11748           0 :                 newOwnerId = tuple_class->relowner;
   11749             :             }
   11750          20 :             break;
   11751             :         case RELKIND_PARTITIONED_INDEX:
   11752           0 :             if (recursing)
   11753           0 :                 break;
   11754           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   11755             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   11756             :                      errmsg("cannot change owner of index \"%s\"",
   11757             :                             NameStr(tuple_class->relname)),
   11758             :                      errhint("Change the ownership of the index's table, instead.")));
   11759             :             break;
   11760             :         case RELKIND_SEQUENCE:
   11761          10 :             if (!recursing &&
   11762           0 :                 tuple_class->relowner != newOwnerId)
   11763             :             {
   11764             :                 /* if it's an owned sequence, disallow changing it by itself */
   11765             :                 Oid         tableId;
   11766             :                 int32       colId;
   11767             : 
   11768           0 :                 if (sequenceIsOwned(relationOid, DEPENDENCY_AUTO, &tableId, &colId) ||
   11769           0 :                     sequenceIsOwned(relationOid, DEPENDENCY_INTERNAL, &tableId, &colId))
   11770           0 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   11771             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
   11772             :                              errmsg("cannot change owner of sequence \"%s\"",
   11773             :                                     NameStr(tuple_class->relname)),
   11774             :                              errdetail("Sequence \"%s\" is linked to table \"%s\".",
   11775             :                                        NameStr(tuple_class->relname),
   11776             :                                        get_rel_name(tableId))));
   11777             :             }
   11778          10 :             break;
   11779             :         case RELKIND_COMPOSITE_TYPE:
   11780           2 :             if (recursing)
   11781           2 :                 break;
   11782           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   11783             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   11784             :                      errmsg("\"%s\" is a composite type",
   11785             :                             NameStr(tuple_class->relname)),
   11786             :                      errhint("Use ALTER TYPE instead.")));
   11787             :             break;
   11788             :         case RELKIND_TOASTVALUE:
   11789          10 :             if (recursing)
   11790          10 :                 break;
   11791             :             /* FALL THRU */
   11792             :         default:
   11793           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   11794             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   11795             :                      errmsg("\"%s\" is not a table, view, sequence, or foreign table",
   11796             :                             NameStr(tuple_class->relname))));
   11797             :     }
   11798             : 
   11799             :     /*
   11800             :      * If the new owner is the same as the existing owner, consider the
   11801             :      * command to have succeeded.  This is for dump restoration purposes.
   11802             :      */
   11803          76 :     if (tuple_class->relowner != newOwnerId)
   11804             :     {
   11805             :         Datum       repl_val[Natts_pg_class];
   11806             :         bool        repl_null[Natts_pg_class];
   11807             :         bool        repl_repl[Natts_pg_class];
   11808             :         Acl        *newAcl;
   11809             :         Datum       aclDatum;
   11810             :         bool        isNull;
   11811             :         HeapTuple   newtuple;
   11812             : 
   11813             :         /* skip permission checks when recursing to index or toast table */
   11814          72 :         if (!recursing)
   11815             :         {
   11816             :             /* Superusers can always do it */
   11817          30 :             if (!superuser())
   11818             :             {
   11819           0 :                 Oid         namespaceOid = tuple_class->relnamespace;
   11820             :                 AclResult   aclresult;
   11821             : 
   11822             :                 /* Otherwise, must be owner of the existing object */
   11823           0 :                 if (!pg_class_ownercheck(relationOid, GetUserId()))
   11824           0 :                     aclcheck_error(ACLCHECK_NOT_OWNER, get_relkind_objtype(get_rel_relkind(relationOid)),
   11825           0 :                                    RelationGetRelationName(target_rel));
   11826             : 
   11827             :                 /* Must be able to become new owner */
   11828           0 :                 check_is_member_of_role(GetUserId(), newOwnerId);
   11829             : 
   11830             :                 /* New owner must have CREATE privilege on namespace */
   11831           0 :                 aclresult = pg_namespace_aclcheck(namespaceOid, newOwnerId,
   11832             :                                                   ACL_CREATE);
   11833           0 :                 if (aclresult != ACLCHECK_OK)
   11834           0 :                     aclcheck_error(aclresult, OBJECT_SCHEMA,
   11835           0 :                                    get_namespace_name(namespaceOid));
   11836             :             }
   11837             :         }
   11838             : 
   11839          72 :         memset(repl_null, false, sizeof(repl_null));
   11840          72 :         memset(repl_repl, false, sizeof(repl_repl));

   11846             :          * Determine the modified ACL for the new owner.  This is only

   11871             :                                      tuple_class->relowner,
   11872             :                                      newOwnerId);

   11932             : /*
   11933             :  * change_owner_fix_column_acls
   11934             :  *
   11935             :  * Helper function for ATExecChangeOwner.  Scan the columns of the table
   11936             :  * and fix any non-null column ACLs to reflect the new owner.
   11937             :  */

   11939          72 : change_owner_fix_column_acls(Oid relationOid, Oid oldOwnerId, Oid newOwnerId)

   11996             : /*
   11997             :  * change_owner_recurse_to_sequences
   11998             :  *
   11999             :  * Helper function for ATExecChangeOwner.  Examines pg_depend searching
   12000             :  * for sequences that are dependent on serial columns, and changes their
   12001             :  * ownership.
   12002             :  */
   12003             : static void
   12004          72 : change_owner_recurse_to_sequences(Oid relationOid, Oid newOwnerId, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   12005             : {
   12006             :     Relation    depRel;
   12007             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   12008             :     ScanKeyData key[2];
   12009             :     HeapTuple   tup;
   12010             : 
   12011             :     /*
   12012             :      * SERIAL sequences are those having an auto dependency on one of the
   12013             :      * table's columns (we don't care *which* column, exactly).
   12014             :      */

   12016             : 
   12017          72 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   12018             :                 Anum_pg_depend_refclassid,
   12019             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   12020             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationRelationId));

   12025             :     /* we leave refobjsubid unspecified */
   12026             : 
   12027          72 :     scan = systable_beginscan(depRel, DependReferenceIndexId, true,
   12028             :                               NULL, 2, key);
   12029             :

   12032         144 :         Form_pg_depend depForm = (Form_pg_depend) GETSTRUCT(tup);
   12033             :         Relation    seqRel;

   12035             :         /* skip dependencies other than auto dependencies on columns */

   12037          84 :             depForm->classid != RelationRelationId ||

   12039          28 :             !(depForm->deptype == DEPENDENCY_AUTO || depForm->deptype == DEPENDENCY_INTERNAL))

   12051             :         }

   12053             :         /* We don't need to close the sequence while we alter it. */

   12055             :

   12330             : 
   12331          66 :         heap_freetuple(newtuple);
   12332             : 
   12333          66 :         ReleaseSysCache(tuple);
   12334             : 
   12335          66 :         table_close(toastrel, NoLock);
   12336             :     }
   12337             : 
   12338         188 :     table_close(pgclass, RowExclusiveLock);
   12339             : }
   12340             : 
   12341             : /*
   12342             :  * Execute ALTER TABLE SET TABLESPACE for cases where there is no tuple
   12343             :  * rewriting to be done, so we just want to copy the data as fast as possible.
   12344             :  */

   12478             : /*
   12479             :  * Special handling of ALTER TABLE SET TABLESPACE for relations with no
   12480             :  * storage that have an interest in preserving tablespace.
   12481             :  *
   12482             :  * Since these have no storage the tablespace can be updated with a simple
   12483             :  * metadata only operation to update the tablespace.

   12539             : /*
   12540             :  * Alter Table ALL ... SET TABLESPACE
   12541             :  *
   12542             :  * Allows a user to move all objects of some type in a given tablespace in the
   12543             :  * current database to another tablespace.  Objects can be chosen based on the
   12544             :  * owner of the object also, to allow users to move only their objects.
   12545             :  * The user must have CREATE rights on the new tablespace, as usual.   The main
   12546             :  * permissions handling is done by the lower-level table move function.
   12547             :  *
   12548             :  * All to-be-moved objects are locked first. If NOWAIT is specified and the
   12549             :  * lock can't be acquired then we ereport(ERROR).
   12550             :  */
   12551             : Oid
   12552           6 : AlterTableMoveAll(AlterTableMoveAllStmt *stmt)
   12553             : {
   12554           6 :     List       *relations = NIL;
   12555             :     ListCell   *l;
   12556             :     ScanKeyData key[1];
   12557             :     Relation    rel;
   12558             :     TableScanDesc scan;
   12559             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   12560             :     Oid         orig_tablespaceoid;
   12561             :     Oid         new_tablespaceoid;
   12562           6 :     List       *role_oids = roleSpecsToIds(stmt->roles);
   12563             : 
   12564             :     /* Ensure we were not asked to move something we can't */
   12565           6 :     if (stmt->objtype != OBJECT_TABLE && stmt->objtype != OBJECT_INDEX &&
   12566           0 :         stmt->objtype != OBJECT_MATVIEW)
   12567           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12568             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   12569             :                  errmsg("only tables, indexes, and materialized views exist in tablespaces")));
   12570             : 
   12571             :     /* Get the orig and new tablespace OIDs */
   12572           6 :     orig_tablespaceoid = get_tablespace_oid(stmt->orig_tablespacename, false);
   12573           6 :     new_tablespaceoid = get_tablespace_oid(stmt->new_tablespacename, false);
   12574             : 
   12575             :     /* Can't move shared relations in to or out of pg_global */
   12576             :     /* This is also checked by ATExecSetTableSpace, but nice to stop earlier */
   12577           6 :     if (orig_tablespaceoid == GLOBALTABLESPACE_OID ||
   12578             :         new_tablespaceoid == GLOBALTABLESPACE_OID)
   12579           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12580             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   12581             :                  errmsg("cannot move relations in to or out of pg_global tablespace")));
   12582             : 
   12583             :     /*
   12584             :      * Must have CREATE rights on the new tablespace, unless it is the

   12586             :      * rights on).

   12607           6 :         new_tablespaceoid = InvalidOid;

   12609             :     /* no-op */

   12614             :      * Walk the list of objects in the tablespace and move them. This will

   12712             : 
   12713             : static void
   12714          12 : index_copy_data(Relation rel, RelFileNode newrnode)
   12715             : {
   12716             :     SMgrRelation dstrel;
   12717             : 
   12718          12 :     dstrel = smgropen(newrnode, rel->rd_backend);
   12719          12 :     RelationOpenSmgr(rel);
   12720             : 
   12721             :     /*
   12722             :      * Since we copy the file directly without looking at the shared buffers,
   12723             :      * we'd better first flush out any pages of the source relation that are
   12724             :      * in shared buffers.  We assume no new changes will be made while we are
   12725             :      * holding exclusive lock on the rel.
   12726             :      */
   12727          12 :     FlushRelationBuffers(rel);
   12728             : 
   12729             :     /*
   12730             :      * Create and copy all forks of the relation, and schedule unlinking of
   12731             :      * old physical files.
   12732             :      *
   12733             :      * NOTE: any conflict in relfilenode value will be caught in
   12734             :      * RelationCreateStorage().

   12737             : 
   12738             :     /* copy main fork */

   12740          12 :                         rel->rd_rel->relpersistence);
   12741             : 
   12742             :     /* copy those extra forks that exist */

   12764          12 :     RelationDropStorage(rel);

   12792             : /*
   12793             :  * ALTER TABLE INHERIT
   12794             :  *
   12795             :  * Add a parent to the child's parents. This verifies that all the columns and
   12796             :  * check constraints of the parent appear in the child and that they have the
   12797             :  * same data types and expressions.
   12798             :  */
   12799             : static void
   12800          46 : ATPrepAddInherit(Relation child_rel)
   12801             : {
   12802          46 :     if (child_rel->rd_rel->reloftype)
   12803           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12804             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12805             :                  errmsg("cannot change inheritance of typed table")));
   12806             : 
   12807          44 :     if (child_rel->rd_rel->relispartition)
   12808           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12809             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12810             :                  errmsg("cannot change inheritance of a partition")));
   12811             : 
   12812          42 :     if (child_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   12813           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12814             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12815             :                  errmsg("cannot change inheritance of partitioned table")));
   12816          40 : }
   12817             : 
   12818             : /*
   12819             :  * Return the address of the new parent relation.
   12820             :  */
   12821             : static ObjectAddress
   12822          40 : ATExecAddInherit(Relation child_rel, RangeVar *parent, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   12823             : {
   12824             :     Relation    parent_rel;
   12825             :     List       *children;
   12826             :     ObjectAddress address;
   12827             :     const char *trigger_name;
   12828             : 
   12829             :     /*
   12830             :      * A self-exclusive lock is needed here.  See the similar case in
   12831             :      * MergeAttributes() for a full explanation.
   12832             :      */
   12833          40 :     parent_rel = table_openrv(parent, ShareUpdateExclusiveLock);
   12834             : 
   12835             :     /*
   12836             :      * Must be owner of both parent and child -- child was checked by
   12837             :      * ATSimplePermissions call in ATPrepCmd
   12838             :      */
   12839          40 :     ATSimplePermissions(parent_rel, ATT_TABLE | ATT_FOREIGN_TABLE);
   12840             : 
   12841             :     /* Permanent rels cannot inherit from temporary ones */
   12842          42 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   12843           2 :         child_rel->rd_rel->relpersistence != RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP)
   12844           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12845             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12846             :                  errmsg("cannot inherit from temporary relation \"%s\"",
   12847             :                         RelationGetRelationName(parent_rel))));
   12848             : 
   12849             :     /* If parent rel is temp, it must belong to this session */
   12850          42 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   12851           2 :         !parent_rel->rd_islocaltemp)
   12852           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12853             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12854             :                  errmsg("cannot inherit from temporary relation of another session")));
   12855             : 
   12856             :     /* Ditto for the child */
   12857          42 :     if (child_rel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   12858           2 :         !child_rel->rd_islocaltemp)
   12859           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12860             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12861             :                  errmsg("cannot inherit to temporary relation of another session")));
   12862             : 
   12863             :     /* Prevent partitioned tables from becoming inheritance parents */
   12864          40 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   12865           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12866             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12867             :                  errmsg("cannot inherit from partitioned table \"%s\"",
   12868             :                         parent->relname)));
   12869             : 
   12870             :     /* Likewise for partitions */
   12871          38 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relispartition)
   12872           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12873             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   12874             :                  errmsg("cannot inherit from a partition")));
   12875             : 
   12876             :     /*
   12877             :      * Prevent circularity by seeing if proposed parent inherits from child.
   12878             :      * (In particular, this disallows making a rel inherit from itself.)
   12879             :      *
   12880             :      * This is not completely bulletproof because of race conditions: in
   12881             :      * multi-level inheritance trees, someone else could concurrently be
   12882             :      * making another inheritance link that closes the loop but does not join
   12883             :      * either of the rels we have locked.  Preventing that seems to require
   12884             :      * exclusive locks on the entire inheritance tree, which is a cure worse
   12885             :      * than the disease.  find_all_inheritors() will cope with circularity
   12886             :      * anyway, so don't sweat it too much.
   12887             :      *
   12888             :      * We use weakest lock we can on child's children, namely AccessShareLock.
   12889             :      */
   12890          36 :     children = find_all_inheritors(RelationGetRelid(child_rel),
   12891             :                                    AccessShareLock, NULL);
   12892             : 
   12893          36 :     if (list_member_oid(children, RelationGetRelid(parent_rel)))
   12894           4 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12895             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_DUPLICATE_TABLE),
   12896             :                  errmsg("circular inheritance not allowed"),
   12897             :                  errdetail("\"%s\" is already a child of \"%s\".",
   12898             :                            parent->relname,
   12899             :                            RelationGetRelationName(child_rel))));
   12900             : 
   12901             :     /*
   12902             :      * If child_rel has row-level triggers with transition tables, we
   12903             :      * currently don't allow it to become an inheritance child.  See also
   12904             :      * prohibitions in ATExecAttachPartition() and CreateTrigger().
   12905             :      */
   12906          32 :     trigger_name = FindTriggerIncompatibleWithInheritance(child_rel->trigdesc);
   12907          32 :     if (trigger_name != NULL)
   12908           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   12909             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
   12910             :                  errmsg("trigger \"%s\" prevents table \"%s\" from becoming an inheritance child",
   12911             :                         trigger_name, RelationGetRelationName(child_rel)),
   12912             :                  errdetail("ROW triggers with transition tables are not supported in inheritance hierarchies.")));
   12913             : 
   12914             :     /* OK to create inheritance */
   12915          30 :     CreateInheritance(child_rel, parent_rel);
   12916             : 
   12917          20 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId,
   12918             :                      RelationGetRelid(parent_rel));
   12919             : 
   12920             :     /* keep our lock on the parent relation until commit */
   12921          20 :     table_close(parent_rel, NoLock);
   12922             : 
   12923          20 :     return address;
   12924             : }
   12925             : 
   12926             : /*
   12927             :  * CreateInheritance
   12928             :  *      Catalog manipulation portion of creating inheritance between a child
   12929             :  *      table and a parent table.
   12930             :  *
   12931             :  * Common to ATExecAddInherit() and ATExecAttachPartition().
   12932             :  */
   12933             : static void
   12934         356 : CreateInheritance(Relation child_rel, Relation parent_rel)
   12935             : {
   12936             :     Relation    catalogRelation;
   12937             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   12938             :     ScanKeyData key;
   12939             :     HeapTuple   inheritsTuple;
   12940             :     int32       inhseqno;
   12941             : 
   12942             :     /* Note: get RowExclusiveLock because we will write pg_inherits below. */
   12943         356 :     catalogRelation = table_open(InheritsRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   12944             : 
   12945             :     /*
   12946             :      * Check for duplicates in the list of parents, and determine the highest
   12947             :      * inhseqno already present; we'll use the next one for the new parent.
   12948             :      * Also, if proposed child is a partition, it cannot already be
   12949             :      * inheriting.
   12950             :      *
   12951             :      * Note: we do not reject the case where the child already inherits from
   12952             :      * the parent indirectly; CREATE TABLE doesn't reject comparable cases.
   12953             :      */
   12954         356 :     ScanKeyInit(&key,
   12955             :                 Anum_pg_inherits_inhrelid,
   12956             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   12957         356 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(child_rel)));
   12958         356 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, InheritsRelidSeqnoIndexId,
   12959             :                               true, NULL, 1, &key);
   12960             : 
   12961             :     /* inhseqno sequences start at 1 */
   12962         356 :     inhseqno = 0;
   12963         722 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(inheritsTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   12964             :     {
   12965          12 :         Form_pg_inherits inh = (Form_pg_inherits) GETSTRUCT(inheritsTuple);
   12966             : 
   12967          12 :         if (inh->inhparent == RelationGetRelid(parent_rel))
   12968           2 :             ereport(ERROR,
   12969             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_DUPLICATE_TABLE),
   12970             :                      errmsg("relation \"%s\" would be inherited from more than once",
   12971             :                             RelationGetRelationName(parent_rel))));
   12972             : 
   12973          10 :         if (inh->inhseqno > inhseqno)
   12974          10 :             inhseqno = inh->inhseqno;
   12975             :     }
   12976         354 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   12977             : 
   12978             :     /* Match up the columns and bump attinhcount as needed */
   12979         354 :     MergeAttributesIntoExisting(child_rel, parent_rel);
   12980             : 
   12981             :     /* Match up the constraints and bump coninhcount as needed */
   12982         342 :     MergeConstraintsIntoExisting(child_rel, parent_rel);
   12983             : 
   12984             :     /*
   12985             :      * OK, it looks valid.  Make the catalog entries that show inheritance.
   12986             :      */
   12987         332 :     StoreCatalogInheritance1(RelationGetRelid(child_rel),
   12988             :                              RelationGetRelid(parent_rel),
   12989             :                              inhseqno + 1,
   12990             :                              catalogRelation,
   12991         332 :                              parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind ==
   12992             :                              RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE);
   12993             : 
   12994             :     /* Now we're done with pg_inherits */
   12995         332 :     table_close(catalogRelation, RowExclusiveLock);
   12996         332 : }
   12997             : 
   12998             : /*
   12999             :  * Obtain the source-text form of the constraint expression for a check
   13000             :  * constraint, given its pg_constraint tuple
   13001             :  */
   13002             : static char *
   13003          28 : decompile_conbin(HeapTuple contup, TupleDesc tupdesc)
   13004             : {
   13005             :     Form_pg_constraint con;
   13006             :     bool        isnull;
   13007             :     Datum       attr;
   13008             :     Datum       expr;
   13009             : 
   13010          28 :     con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(contup);
   13011          28 :     attr = heap_getattr(contup, Anum_pg_constraint_conbin, tupdesc, &isnull);
   13012          28 :     if (isnull)
   13013           0 :         elog(ERROR, "null conbin for constraint %u", con->oid);
   13014             : 
   13015          28 :     expr = DirectFunctionCall2(pg_get_expr, attr,
   13016             :                                ObjectIdGetDatum(con->conrelid));
   13017          28 :     return TextDatumGetCString(expr);
   13018             : }
   13019             : 
   13020             : /*
   13021             :  * Determine whether two check constraints are functionally equivalent
   13022             :  *
   13023             :  * The test we apply is to see whether they reverse-compile to the same
   13024             :  * source string.  This insulates us from issues like whether attributes
   13025             :  * have the same physical column numbers in parent and child relations.
   13026             :  */
   13027             : static bool
   13028          14 : constraints_equivalent(HeapTuple a, HeapTuple b, TupleDesc tupleDesc)
   13029             : {
   13030          14 :     Form_pg_constraint acon = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(a);
   13031          14 :     Form_pg_constraint bcon = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(b);
   13032             : 
   13033          28 :     if (acon->condeferrable != bcon->condeferrable ||
   13034          28 :         acon->condeferred != bcon->condeferred ||
   13035          14 :         strcmp(decompile_conbin(a, tupleDesc),
   13036          14 :                decompile_conbin(b, tupleDesc)) != 0)
   13037           2 :         return false;
   13038             :     else
   13039          12 :         return true;
   13040             : }
   13041             : 
   13042             : /*
   13043             :  * Check columns in child table match up with columns in parent, and increment
   13044             :  * their attinhcount.
   13045             :  *
   13046             :  * Called by CreateInheritance
   13047             :  *
   13048             :  * Currently all parent columns must be found in child. Missing columns are an
   13049             :  * error.  One day we might consider creating new columns like CREATE TABLE
   13050             :  * does.  However, that is widely unpopular --- in the common use case of
   13051             :  * partitioned tables it's a foot-gun.
   13052             :  *
   13053             :  * The data type must match exactly. If the parent column is NOT NULL then
   13054             :  * the child must be as well. Defaults are not compared, however.
   13055             :  */
   13056             : static void
   13057         354 : MergeAttributesIntoExisting(Relation child_rel, Relation parent_rel)
   13058             : {
   13059             :     Relation    attrrel;
   13060             :     AttrNumber  parent_attno;
   13061             :     int         parent_natts;
   13062             :     TupleDesc   tupleDesc;
   13063             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   13064         354 :     bool        child_is_partition = false;
   13065             : 
   13066         354 :     attrrel = table_open(AttributeRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   13067             : 
   13068         354 :     tupleDesc = RelationGetDescr(parent_rel);
   13069         354 :     parent_natts = tupleDesc->natts;
   13070             : 
   13071             :     /* If parent_rel is a partitioned table, child_rel must be a partition */
   13072         354 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   13073         326 :         child_is_partition = true;
   13074             : 
   13075        1136 :     for (parent_attno = 1; parent_attno <= parent_natts; parent_attno++)
   13076             :     {
   13077         794 :         Form_pg_attribute attribute = TupleDescAttr(tupleDesc,
   13078             :                                                     parent_attno - 1);
   13079         794 :         char       *attributeName = NameStr(attribute->attname);
   13080             : 
   13081             :         /* Ignore dropped columns in the parent. */
   13082         794 :         if (attribute->attisdropped)
   13083          64 :             continue;
   13084             : 
   13085             :         /* Find same column in child (matching on column name). */
   13086         730 :         tuple = SearchSysCacheCopyAttName(RelationGetRelid(child_rel),
   13087             :                                           attributeName);
   13088         730 :         if (HeapTupleIsValid(tuple))
   13089             :         {
   13090             :             /* Check they are same type, typmod, and collation */
   13091         726 :             Form_pg_attribute childatt = (Form_pg_attribute) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   13092             : 
   13093        1450 :             if (attribute->atttypid != childatt->atttypid ||
   13094         724 :                 attribute->atttypmod != childatt->atttypmod)
   13095           4 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   13096             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   13097             :                          errmsg("child table \"%s\" has different type for column \"%s\"",
   13098             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(child_rel),
   13099             :                                 attributeName)));
   13100             : 
   13101         722 :             if (attribute->attcollation != childatt->attcollation)
   13102           2 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   13103             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_COLLATION_MISMATCH),
   13104             :                          errmsg("child table \"%s\" has different collation for column \"%s\"",
   13105             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(child_rel),
   13106             :                                 attributeName)));
   13107             : 
   13108             :             /*
   13109             :              * Check child doesn't discard NOT NULL property.  (Other
   13110             :              * constraints are checked elsewhere.)
   13111             :              */
   13112         720 :             if (attribute->attnotnull && !childatt->attnotnull)
   13113           2 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   13114             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   13115             :                          errmsg("column \"%s\" in child table must be marked NOT NULL",
   13116             :                                 attributeName)));
   13117             : 
   13118             :             /*
   13119             :              * OK, bump the child column's inheritance count.  (If we fail
   13120             :              * later on, this change will just roll back.)
   13121             :              */
   13122         718 :             childatt->attinhcount++;
   13123             : 
   13124             :             /*
   13125             :              * In case of partitions, we must enforce that value of attislocal
   13126             :              * is same in all partitions. (Note: there are only inherited
   13127             :              * attributes in partitions)
   13128             :              */
   13129         718 :             if (child_is_partition)
   13130             :             {
   13131         660 :                 Assert(childatt->attinhcount == 1);
   13132         660 :                 childatt->attislocal = false;
   13133             :             }
   13134             : 
   13135         718 :             CatalogTupleUpdate(attrrel, &tuple->t_self, tuple);
   13136         718 :             heap_freetuple(tuple);
   13137             :         }
   13138             :         else
   13139             :         {
   13140           4 :             ereport(ERROR,
   13141             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   13142             :                      errmsg("child table is missing column \"%s\"",
   13143             :                             attributeName)));
   13144             :         }
   13145             :     }
   13146             : 
   13147         342 :     table_close(attrrel, RowExclusiveLock);
   13148         342 : }
   13149             : 
   13150             : /*
   13151             :  * Check constraints in child table match up with constraints in parent,
   13152             :  * and increment their coninhcount.
   13153             :  *
   13154             :  * Constraints that are marked ONLY in the parent are ignored.
   13155             :  *
   13156             :  * Called by CreateInheritance
   13157             :  *
   13158             :  * Currently all constraints in parent must be present in the child. One day we
   13159             :  * may consider adding new constraints like CREATE TABLE does.
   13160             :  *
   13161             :  * XXX This is O(N^2) which may be an issue with tables with hundreds of
   13162             :  * constraints. As long as tables have more like 10 constraints it shouldn't be
   13163             :  * a problem though. Even 100 constraints ought not be the end of the world.
   13164             :  *
   13165             :  * XXX See MergeWithExistingConstraint too if you change this code.
   13166             :  */
   13167             : static void
   13168         342 : MergeConstraintsIntoExisting(Relation child_rel, Relation parent_rel)
   13169             : {
   13170             :     Relation    catalog_relation;
   13171             :     TupleDesc   tuple_desc;
   13172             :     SysScanDesc parent_scan;
   13173             :     ScanKeyData parent_key;
   13174             :     HeapTuple   parent_tuple;
   13175         342 :     bool        child_is_partition = false;
   13176             : 
   13177         342 :     catalog_relation = table_open(ConstraintRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   13178         342 :     tuple_desc = RelationGetDescr(catalog_relation);
   13179             : 
   13180             :     /* If parent_rel is a partitioned table, child_rel must be a partition */
   13181         342 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   13182         318 :         child_is_partition = true;
   13183             : 
   13184             :     /* Outer loop scans through the parent's constraint definitions */
   13185         342 :     ScanKeyInit(&parent_key,
   13186             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid,
   13187             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13188         342 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(parent_rel)));
   13189         342 :     parent_scan = systable_beginscan(catalog_relation, ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId,
   13190             :                                      true, NULL, 1, &parent_key);
   13191             : 
   13192         808 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(parent_tuple = systable_getnext(parent_scan)))
   13193             :     {
   13194         134 :         Form_pg_constraint parent_con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(parent_tuple);
   13195             :         SysScanDesc child_scan;
   13196             :         ScanKeyData child_key;
   13197             :         HeapTuple   child_tuple;
   13198         134 :         bool        found = false;
   13199             : 
   13200         134 :         if (parent_con->contype != CONSTRAINT_CHECK)
   13201         220 :             continue;
   13202             : 
   13203             :         /* if the parent's constraint is marked NO INHERIT, it's not inherited */
   13204          26 :         if (parent_con->connoinherit)
   13205           4 :             continue;
   13206             : 
   13207             :         /* Search for a child constraint matching this one */
   13208          22 :         ScanKeyInit(&child_key,
   13209             :                     Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid,
   13210             :                     BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13211          22 :                     ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(child_rel)));
   13212          22 :         child_scan = systable_beginscan(catalog_relation, ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId,
   13213             :                                         true, NULL, 1, &child_key);
   13214             : 
   13215          22 :         while (HeapTupleIsValid(child_tuple = systable_getnext(child_scan)))
   13216             :         {
   13217          16 :             Form_pg_constraint child_con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(child_tuple);
   13218             :             HeapTuple   child_copy;
   13219             : 
   13220          16 :             if (child_con->contype != CONSTRAINT_CHECK)
   13221           0 :                 continue;
   13222             : 
   13223          16 :             if (strcmp(NameStr(parent_con->conname),
   13224          16 :                        NameStr(child_con->conname)) != 0)
   13225           2 :                 continue;
   13226             : 
   13227          14 :             if (!constraints_equivalent(parent_tuple, child_tuple, tuple_desc))
   13228           2 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   13229             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   13230             :                          errmsg("child table \"%s\" has different definition for check constraint \"%s\"",
   13231             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(child_rel),
   13232             :                                 NameStr(parent_con->conname))));
   13233             : 
   13234             :             /* If the child constraint is "no inherit" then cannot merge */
   13235          12 :             if (child_con->connoinherit)
   13236           0 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   13237             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   13238             :                          errmsg("constraint \"%s\" conflicts with non-inherited constraint on child table \"%s\"",
   13239             :                                 NameStr(child_con->conname),
   13240             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(child_rel))));
   13241             : 
   13242             :             /*
   13243             :              * If the child constraint is "not valid" then cannot merge with a
   13244             :              * valid parent constraint
   13245             :              */
   13246          12 :             if (parent_con->convalidated && !child_con->convalidated)
   13247           0 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   13248             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   13249             :                          errmsg("constraint \"%s\" conflicts with NOT VALID constraint on child table \"%s\"",
   13250             :                                 NameStr(child_con->conname),
   13251             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(child_rel))));
   13252             : 
   13253             :             /*
   13254             :              * OK, bump the child constraint's inheritance count.  (If we fail
   13255             :              * later on, this change will just roll back.)
   13256             :              */
   13257          12 :             child_copy = heap_copytuple(child_tuple);
   13258          12 :             child_con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(child_copy);
   13259          12 :             child_con->coninhcount++;
   13260             : 
   13261             :             /*
   13262             :              * In case of partitions, an inherited constraint must be
   13263             :              * inherited only once since it cannot have multiple parents and
   13264             :              * it is never considered local.
   13265             :              */
   13266          12 :             if (child_is_partition)
   13267             :             {
   13268           8 :                 Assert(child_con->coninhcount == 1);
   13269           8 :                 child_con->conislocal = false;
   13270             :             }
   13271             : 
   13272          12 :             CatalogTupleUpdate(catalog_relation, &child_copy->t_self, child_copy);
   13273          12 :             heap_freetuple(child_copy);
   13274             : 
   13275          12 :             found = true;
   13276          12 :             break;
   13277             :         }
   13278             : 
   13279          20 :         systable_endscan(child_scan);
   13280             : 
   13281          20 :         if (!found)
   13282           8 :             ereport(ERROR,
   13283             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   13284             :                      errmsg("child table is missing constraint \"%s\"",
   13285             :                             NameStr(parent_con->conname))));
   13286             :     }
   13287             : 
   13288         332 :     systable_endscan(parent_scan);
   13289         332 :     table_close(catalog_relation, RowExclusiveLock);
   13290         332 : }
   13291             : 
   13292             : /*
   13293             :  * ALTER TABLE NO INHERIT
   13294             :  *
   13295             :  * Return value is the address of the relation that is no longer parent.
   13296             :  */
   13297             : static ObjectAddress
   13298          10 : ATExecDropInherit(Relation rel, RangeVar *parent, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   13299             : {
   13300             :     ObjectAddress address;
   13301             :     Relation    parent_rel;
   13302             : 
   13303          10 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relispartition)
   13304           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   13305             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   13306             :                  errmsg("cannot change inheritance of a partition")));
   13307             : 
   13308             :     /*
   13309             :      * AccessShareLock on the parent is probably enough, seeing that DROP
   13310             :      * TABLE doesn't lock parent tables at all.  We need some lock since we'll
   13311             :      * be inspecting the parent's schema.
   13312             :      */
   13313          10 :     parent_rel = table_openrv(parent, AccessShareLock);
   13314             : 
   13315             :     /*
   13316             :      * We don't bother to check ownership of the parent table --- ownership of
   13317             :      * the child is presumed enough rights.
   13318             :      */
   13319             : 
   13320             :     /* Off to RemoveInheritance() where most of the work happens */
   13321          10 :     RemoveInheritance(rel, parent_rel);
   13322             : 
   13323           8 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId,
   13324             :                      RelationGetRelid(parent_rel));
   13325             : 
   13326             :     /* keep our lock on the parent relation until commit */
   13327           8 :     table_close(parent_rel, NoLock);
   13328             : 
   13329           8 :     return address;
   13330             : }
   13331             : 
   13332             : /*
   13333             :  * RemoveInheritance
   13334             :  *
   13335             :  * Drop a parent from the child's parents. This just adjusts the attinhcount
   13336             :  * and attislocal of the columns and removes the pg_inherit and pg_depend
   13337             :  * entries.
   13338             :  *
   13339             :  * If attinhcount goes to 0 then attislocal gets set to true. If it goes back
   13340             :  * up attislocal stays true, which means if a child is ever removed from a
   13341             :  * parent then its columns will never be automatically dropped which may
   13342             :  * surprise. But at least we'll never surprise by dropping columns someone
   13343             :  * isn't expecting to be dropped which would actually mean data loss.
   13344             :  *
   13345             :  * coninhcount and conislocal for inherited constraints are adjusted in
   13346             :  * exactly the same way.
   13347             :  *
   13348             :  * Common to ATExecDropInherit() and ATExecDetachPartition().
   13349             :  */
   13350             : static void
   13351          76 : RemoveInheritance(Relation child_rel, Relation parent_rel)
   13352             : {
   13353             :     Relation    catalogRelation;
   13354             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   13355             :     ScanKeyData key[3];
   13356             :     HeapTuple   attributeTuple,
   13357             :                 constraintTuple;
   13358             :     List       *connames;
   13359             :     bool        found;
   13360          76 :     bool        child_is_partition = false;
   13361             : 
   13362             :     /* If parent_rel is a partitioned table, child_rel must be a partition */
   13363          76 :     if (parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   13364          66 :         child_is_partition = true;
   13365             : 
   13366          76 :     found = DeleteInheritsTuple(RelationGetRelid(child_rel),
   13367             :                                 RelationGetRelid(parent_rel));
   13368          76 :     if (!found)
   13369             :     {
   13370           8 :         if (child_is_partition)
   13371           6 :             ereport(ERROR,
   13372             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_TABLE),
   13373             :                      errmsg("relation \"%s\" is not a partition of relation \"%s\"",
   13374             :                             RelationGetRelationName(child_rel),
   13375             :                             RelationGetRelationName(parent_rel))));
   13376             :         else
   13377           2 :             ereport(ERROR,
   13378             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_TABLE),
   13379             :                      errmsg("relation \"%s\" is not a parent of relation \"%s\"",
   13380             :                             RelationGetRelationName(parent_rel),
   13381             :                             RelationGetRelationName(child_rel))));
   13382             :     }
   13383             : 
   13384             :     /*
   13385             :      * Search through child columns looking for ones matching parent rel
   13386             :      */
   13387          68 :     catalogRelation = table_open(AttributeRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   13388          68 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   13389             :                 Anum_pg_attribute_attrelid,
   13390             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13391          68 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(child_rel)));
   13392          68 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, AttributeRelidNumIndexId,
   13393             :                               true, NULL, 1, key);
   13394         674 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(attributeTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   13395             :     {
   13396         538 :         Form_pg_attribute att = (Form_pg_attribute) GETSTRUCT(attributeTuple);
   13397             : 
   13398             :         /* Ignore if dropped or not inherited */
   13399         538 :         if (att->attisdropped)
   13400           0 :             continue;
   13401         538 :         if (att->attinhcount <= 0)
   13402         414 :             continue;
   13403             : 
   13404         124 :         if (SearchSysCacheExistsAttName(RelationGetRelid(parent_rel),
   13405         124 :                                         NameStr(att->attname)))
   13406             :         {
   13407             :             /* Decrement inhcount and possibly set islocal to true */
   13408         120 :             HeapTuple   copyTuple = heap_copytuple(attributeTuple);
   13409         120 :             Form_pg_attribute copy_att = (Form_pg_attribute) GETSTRUCT(copyTuple);
   13410             : 
   13411         120 :             copy_att->attinhcount--;
   13412         120 :             if (copy_att->attinhcount == 0)
   13413         120 :                 copy_att->attislocal = true;
   13414             : 
   13415         120 :             CatalogTupleUpdate(catalogRelation, &copyTuple->t_self, copyTuple);
   13416         120 :             heap_freetuple(copyTuple);
   13417             :         }
   13418             :     }
   13419          68 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   13420          68 :     table_close(catalogRelation, RowExclusiveLock);
   13421             : 
   13422             :     /*
   13423             :      * Likewise, find inherited check constraints and disinherit them. To do
   13424             :      * this, we first need a list of the names of the parent's check
   13425             :      * constraints.  (We cheat a bit by only checking for name matches,
   13426             :      * assuming that the expressions will match.)
   13427             :      */
   13428          68 :     catalogRelation = table_open(ConstraintRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   13429          68 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   13430             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid,
   13431             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13432          68 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(parent_rel)));
   13433          68 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId,
   13434             :                               true, NULL, 1, key);
   13435             : 
   13436          68 :     connames = NIL;
   13437             : 
   13438         162 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(constraintTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   13439             :     {
   13440          26 :         Form_pg_constraint con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(constraintTuple);
   13441             : 
   13442          26 :         if (con->contype == CONSTRAINT_CHECK)
   13443           4 :             connames = lappend(connames, pstrdup(NameStr(con->conname)));
   13444             :     }
   13445             : 
   13446          68 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   13447             : 
   13448             :     /* Now scan the child's constraints */
   13449          68 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   13450             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid,
   13451             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13452          68 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(child_rel)));
   13453          68 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId,
   13454             :                               true, NULL, 1, key);
   13455             : 
   13456         184 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(constraintTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   13457             :     {
   13458          48 :         Form_pg_constraint con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(constraintTuple);
   13459             :         bool        match;
   13460             :         ListCell   *lc;
   13461             : 
   13462          48 :         if (con->contype != CONSTRAINT_CHECK)
   13463          28 :             continue;
   13464             : 
   13465          20 :         match = false;
   13466          24 :         foreach(lc, connames)
   13467             :         {
   13468           8 :             if (strcmp(NameStr(con->conname), (char *) lfirst(lc)) == 0)
   13469             :             {
   13470           4 :                 match = true;
   13471           4 :                 break;
   13472             :             }
   13473             :         }
   13474             : 
   13475          20 :         if (match)
   13476             :         {
   13477             :             /* Decrement inhcount and possibly set islocal to true */
   13478           4 :             HeapTuple   copyTuple = heap_copytuple(constraintTuple);

   13480             : 
   13481           4 :             if (copy_con->coninhcount <= 0) /* shouldn't happen */
   13482           0 :                 elog(ERROR, "relation %u has non-inherited constraint \"%s\"",
   13483             :                      RelationGetRelid(child_rel), NameStr(copy_con->conname));
   13484             : 
   13485           4 :             copy_con->coninhcount--;
   13486           4 :             if (copy_con->coninhcount == 0)
   13487           4 :                 copy_con->conislocal = true;
   13488             : 
   13489           4 :             CatalogTupleUpdate(catalogRelation, &copyTuple->t_self, copyTuple);
   13490           4 :             heap_freetuple(copyTuple);
   13491             :         }
   13492             :     }
   13493             : 
   13494          68 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   13495          68 :     table_close(catalogRelation, RowExclusiveLock);
   13496             : 
   13497          68 :     drop_parent_dependency(RelationGetRelid(child_rel),
   13498             :                            RelationRelationId,
   13499             :                            RelationGetRelid(parent_rel),
   13500             :                            child_dependency_type(child_is_partition));
   13501             : 
   13502             :     /*
   13503             :      * Post alter hook of this inherits. Since object_access_hook doesn't take
   13504             :      * multiple object identifiers, we relay oid of parent relation using
   13505             :      * auxiliary_id argument.
   13506             :      */

   13508             :                                  RelationGetRelid(child_rel), 0,
   13509             :                                  RelationGetRelid(parent_rel), false);
   13510          68 : }
   13511             : 
   13512             : /*
   13513             :  * Drop the dependency created by StoreCatalogInheritance1 (CREATE TABLE
   13514             :  * INHERITS/ALTER TABLE INHERIT -- refclassid will be RelationRelationId) or
   13515             :  * heap_create_with_catalog (CREATE TABLE OF/ALTER TABLE OF -- refclassid will
   13516             :  * be TypeRelationId).  There's no convenient way to do this, so go trawling
   13517             :  * through pg_depend.
   13518             :  */
   13519             : static void
   13520          72 : drop_parent_dependency(Oid relid, Oid refclassid, Oid refobjid,
   13521             :                        DependencyType deptype)
   13522             : {
   13523             :     Relation    catalogRelation;
   13524             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   13525             :     ScanKeyData key[3];
   13526             :     HeapTuple   depTuple;
   13527             : 
   13528          72 :     catalogRelation = table_open(DependRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   13529             : 
   13530          72 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   13531             :                 Anum_pg_depend_classid,
   13532             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13533             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationRelationId));
   13534          72 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[1],
   13535             :                 Anum_pg_depend_objid,
   13536             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13537             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(relid));
   13538          72 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[2],
   13539             :                 Anum_pg_depend_objsubid,
   13540             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_INT4EQ,
   13541             :                 Int32GetDatum(0));
   13542             : 
   13543          72 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, DependDependerIndexId, true,
   13544             :                               NULL, 3, key);
   13545             : 
   13546         296 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(depTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   13547             :     {
   13548         152 :         Form_pg_depend dep = (Form_pg_depend) GETSTRUCT(depTuple);
   13549             : 
   13550         228 :         if (dep->refclassid == refclassid &&
   13551         148 :             dep->refobjid == refobjid &&
   13552         144 :             dep->refobjsubid == 0 &&
   13553          72 :             dep->deptype == deptype)
   13554          72 :             CatalogTupleDelete(catalogRelation, &depTuple->t_self);
   13555             :     }
   13556             : 
   13557          72 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   13558          72 :     table_close(catalogRelation, RowExclusiveLock);
   13559          72 : }
   13560             : 
   13561             : /*
   13562             :  * ALTER TABLE OF
   13563             :  *
   13564             :  * Attach a table to a composite type, as though it had been created with CREATE
   13565             :  * TABLE OF.  All attname, atttypid, atttypmod and attcollation must match.  The
   13566             :  * subject table must not have inheritance parents.  These restrictions ensure
   13567             :  * that you cannot create a configuration impossible with CREATE TABLE OF alone.
   13568             :  *
   13569             :  * The address of the type is returned.
   13570             :  */
   13571             : static ObjectAddress
   13572          18 : ATExecAddOf(Relation rel, const TypeName *ofTypename, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   13573             : {
   13574          18 :     Oid         relid = RelationGetRelid(rel);
   13575             :     Type        typetuple;
   13576             :     Form_pg_type typeform;
   13577             :     Oid         typeid;
   13578             :     Relation    inheritsRelation,
   13579             :                 relationRelation;
   13580             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   13581             :     ScanKeyData key;
   13582             :     AttrNumber  table_attno,
   13583             :                 type_attno;
   13584             :     TupleDesc   typeTupleDesc,
   13585             :                 tableTupleDesc;
   13586             :     ObjectAddress tableobj,
   13587             :                 typeobj;
   13588             :     HeapTuple   classtuple;
   13589             : 
   13590             :     /* Validate the type. */
   13591          18 :     typetuple = typenameType(NULL, ofTypename, NULL);
   13592          18 :     check_of_type(typetuple);
   13593          18 :     typeform = (Form_pg_type) GETSTRUCT(typetuple);
   13594          18 :     typeid = typeform->oid;
   13595             : 
   13596             :     /* Fail if the table has any inheritance parents. */
   13597          18 :     inheritsRelation = table_open(InheritsRelationId, AccessShareLock);
   13598          18 :     ScanKeyInit(&key,
   13599             :                 Anum_pg_inherits_inhrelid,
   13600             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   13601             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(relid));
   13602          18 :     scan = systable_beginscan(inheritsRelation, InheritsRelidSeqnoIndexId,
   13603             :                               true, NULL, 1, &key);
   13604          18 :     if (HeapTupleIsValid(systable_getnext(scan)))
   13605           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   13606             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   13607             :                  errmsg("typed tables cannot inherit")));
   13608          16 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   13609          16 :     table_close(inheritsRelation, AccessShareLock);
   13610             : 
   13611             :     /*
   13612             :      * Check the tuple descriptors for compatibility.  Unlike inheritance, we
   13613             :      * require that the order also match.  However, attnotnull need not match.
   13614             :      */
   13615          16 :     typeTupleDesc = lookup_rowtype_tupdesc(typeid, -1);
   13616          16 :     tableTupleDesc = RelationGetDescr(rel);
   13617          16 :     table_attno = 1;
   13618          52 :     for (type_attno = 1; type_attno <= typeTupleDesc->natts; type_attno++)

   13633             :         {

   13638             :                                 type_attname)));

   13643             :

   13674             : 
   13675             :     /* If the table was already typed, drop the existing dependency. */

   13688             :

   13693           0 :         elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for relation %u", relid);

   13696             : 
   13697           6 :     InvokeObjectPostAlterHook(RelationRelationId, relid, 0);

   13699           6 :     heap_freetuple(classtuple);

   13701             : 
   13702           6 :     ReleaseSysCache(typetuple);

   13706             : 
   13707             : /*
   13708             :  * ALTER TABLE NOT OF
   13709             :  *
   13710             :  * Detach a typed table from its originating type.  Just clear reloftype and
   13711             :  * remove the dependency.
   13712             :  */
   13713             : static void
   13714           2 : ATExecDropOf(Relation rel, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   13715             : {
   13716           2 :     Oid         relid = RelationGetRelid(rel);
   13717             :     Relation    relationRelation;
   13718             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   13719             : 
   13720           2 :     if (!OidIsValid(rel->rd_rel->reloftype))
   13721           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   13722             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   13723             :                  errmsg("\"%s\" is not a typed table",
   13724             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel))));
   13725             : 
   13726             :     /*
   13727             :      * We don't bother to check ownership of the type --- ownership of the
   13728             :      * table is presumed enough rights.  No lock required on the type, either.
   13729             :      */
   13730             : 
   13731           2 :     drop_parent_dependency(relid, TypeRelationId, rel->rd_rel->reloftype,
   13732             :                            DEPENDENCY_NORMAL);
   13733             : 
   13734             :     /* Clear pg_class.reloftype */
   13735           2 :     relationRelation = table_open(RelationRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);

   13738           0 :         elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for relation %u", relid);

   13741             : 
   13742           2 :     InvokeObjectPostAlterHook(RelationRelationId, relid, 0);
   13743             : 
   13744           2 :     heap_freetuple(tuple);
   13745           2 :     table_close(relationRelation, RowExclusiveLock);
   13746           2 : }
   13747             : 
   13748             : /*
   13749             :  * relation_mark_replica_identity: Update a table's replica identity
   13750             :  *
   13751             :  * Iff ri_type = REPLICA_IDENTITY_INDEX, indexOid must be the Oid of a suitable
   13752             :  * index. Otherwise, it should be InvalidOid.
   13753             :  */
   13754             : static void
   13755          14 : relation_mark_replica_identity(Relation rel, char ri_type, Oid indexOid,
   13756             :                                bool is_internal)
   13757             : {
   13758             :     Relation    pg_index;

   13768             :      * Check whether relreplident has changed, and update it if so.
   13769             :      */

   13771          14 :     pg_class_tuple = SearchSysCacheCopy1(RELOID,
   13772             :                                          ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(rel)));

   13776          14 :     pg_class_form = (Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(pg_class_tuple);

   13778             :     {
   13779           8 :         pg_class_form->relreplident = ri_type;
   13780           8 :         CatalogTupleUpdate(pg_class, &pg_class_tuple->t_self, pg_class_tuple);
   13781             :     }
   13782          14 :     table_close(pg_class, RowExclusiveLock);
