   14117             : 
   14118             : /*
   14119             :  * Preparation phase for SET LOGGED/UNLOGGED
   14120             :  *
   14121             :  * This verifies that we're not trying to change a temp table.  Also,
   14122             :  * existing foreign key constraints are checked to avoid ending up with
   14123             :  * permanent tables referencing unlogged tables.
   14124             :  *
   14125             :  * Return value is false if the operation is a no-op (in which case the
   14126             :  * checks are skipped), otherwise true.
   14127             :  */
   14128             : static bool
   14129          18 : ATPrepChangePersistence(Relation rel, bool toLogged)
   14130             : {
   14131             :     Relation    pg_constraint;
   14132             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   14133             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   14134             :     ScanKeyData skey[1];
   14135             : 
   14136             :     /*
   14137             :      * Disallow changing status for a temp table.  Also verify whether we can
   14138             :      * get away with doing nothing; in such cases we don't need to run the
   14139             :      * checks below, either.
   14140             :      */
   14141          18 :     switch (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence)
   14142             :     {
   14143             :         case RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP:
   14144           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   14145             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TABLE_DEFINITION),
   14146             :                      errmsg("cannot change logged status of table \"%s\" because it is temporary",
   14147             :                             RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   14148             :                      errtable(rel)));
   14149             :             break;
   14150             :         case RELPERSISTENCE_PERMANENT:
   14151          10 :             if (toLogged)
   14152             :                 /* nothing to do */
   14153           2 :                 return false;
   14154           8 :             break;
   14155             :         case RELPERSISTENCE_UNLOGGED:
   14156           8 :             if (!toLogged)
   14157             :                 /* nothing to do */
   14158           2 :                 return false;
   14159           6 :             break;
   14160             :     }
   14161             : 
   14162             :     /*
   14163             :      * Check that the table is not part any publication when changing to
   14164             :      * UNLOGGED as UNLOGGED tables can't be published.
   14165             :      */
   14166          22 :     if (!toLogged &&
   14167           8 :         list_length(GetRelationPublications(RelationGetRelid(rel))) > 0)
   14168           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   14169             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   14170             :                  errmsg("cannot change table \"%s\" to unlogged because it is part of a publication",
   14171             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   14172             :                  errdetail("Unlogged relations cannot be replicated.")));
   14173             : 
   14174             :     /*
   14175             :      * Check existing foreign key constraints to preserve the invariant that
   14176             :      * permanent tables cannot reference unlogged ones.  Self-referencing
   14177             :      * foreign keys can safely be ignored.
   14178             :      */
   14179          14 :     pg_constraint = table_open(ConstraintRelationId, AccessShareLock);
   14180             : 
   14181             :     /*
   14182             :      * Scan conrelid if changing to permanent, else confrelid.  This also
   14183             :      * determines whether a useful index exists.
   14184             :      */
   14185          14 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey[0],
   14186             :                 toLogged ? Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid :
   14187             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_confrelid,
   14188             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   14189          14 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(rel)));
   14190          14 :     scan = systable_beginscan(pg_constraint,
   14191             :                               toLogged ? ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId : InvalidOid,
   14192             :                               true, NULL, 1, skey);
   14193             : 
   14194          38 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(tuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   14195             :     {
   14196          14 :         Form_pg_constraint con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   14197             : 
   14198          14 :         if (con->contype == CONSTRAINT_FOREIGN)
   14199             :         {
   14200             :             Oid         foreignrelid;
   14201             :             Relation    foreignrel;
   14202             : 
   14203             :             /* the opposite end of what we used as scankey */
   14204          10 :             foreignrelid = toLogged ? con->confrelid : con->conrelid;
   14205             : 
   14206             :             /* ignore if self-referencing */
   14207          10 :             if (RelationGetRelid(rel) == foreignrelid)
   14208           4 :                 continue;
   14209             : 
   14210           6 :             foreignrel = relation_open(foreignrelid, AccessShareLock);
   14211             : 
   14212           6 :             if (toLogged)
   14213             :             {
   14214           2 :                 if (foreignrel->rd_rel->relpersistence != RELPERSISTENCE_PERMANENT)
   14215           2 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   14216             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TABLE_DEFINITION),
   14217             :                              errmsg("could not change table \"%s\" to logged because it references unlogged table \"%s\"",
   14218             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(rel),
   14219             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(foreignrel)),
   14220             :                              errtableconstraint(rel, NameStr(con->conname))));
   14221             :             }
   14222             :             else
   14223             :             {
   14224           4 :                 if (foreignrel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_PERMANENT)
   14225           2 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   14226             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TABLE_DEFINITION),
   14227             :                              errmsg("could not change table \"%s\" to unlogged because it references logged table \"%s\"",
   14228             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(rel),
   14229             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(foreignrel)),
   14230             :                              errtableconstraint(rel, NameStr(con->conname))));
   14231             :             }
   14232             : 
   14233           2 :             relation_close(foreignrel, AccessShareLock);
   14234             :         }
   14235             :     }
   14236             : 
   14237          10 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   14238             : 
   14239          10 :     table_close(pg_constraint, AccessShareLock);
   14240             : 
   14241          10 :     return true;
   14242             : }
   14243             : 
   14244             : /*
   14245             :  * Execute ALTER TABLE SET SCHEMA
   14246             :  */
   14247             : ObjectAddress
   14248          28 : AlterTableNamespace(AlterObjectSchemaStmt *stmt, Oid *oldschema)
   14249             : {
   14250             :     Relation    rel;
   14251             :     Oid         relid;
   14252             :     Oid         oldNspOid;
   14253             :     Oid         nspOid;
   14254             :     RangeVar   *newrv;
   14255             :     ObjectAddresses *objsMoved;
   14256             :     ObjectAddress myself;
   14257             : 
   14258          28 :     relid = RangeVarGetRelidExtended(stmt->relation, AccessExclusiveLock,
   14259          28 :                                      stmt->missing_ok ? RVR_MISSING_OK : 0,
   14260             :                                      RangeVarCallbackForAlterRelation,
   14261             :                                      (void *) stmt);
   14262             : 
   14263          28 :     if (!OidIsValid(relid))
   14264             :     {
   14265           4 :         ereport(NOTICE,
   14266             :                 (errmsg("relation \"%s\" does not exist, skipping",
   14267             :                         stmt->relation->relname)));
   14268           4 :         return InvalidObjectAddress;
   14269             :     }
   14270             : 
   14271          24 :     rel = relation_open(relid, NoLock);
   14272             : 
   14273          24 :     oldNspOid = RelationGetNamespace(rel);
   14274             : 
   14275             :     /* If it's an owned sequence, disallow moving it by itself. */
   14276          24 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_SEQUENCE)
   14277             :     {

   14544             : 
   14545             : /*
   14546             :  * This code supports
   14547             :  *  CREATE TEMP TABLE ... ON COMMIT { DROP | PRESERVE ROWS | DELETE ROWS }
   14548             :  *
   14549             :  * Because we only support this for TEMP tables, it's sufficient to remember
   14550             :  * the state in a backend-local data structure.
   14551             :  */
   14552             : 
   14553             : /*
   14554             :  * Register a newly-created relation's ON COMMIT action.
   14555             :  */
   14556             : void
   14557          40 : register_on_commit_action(Oid relid, OnCommitAction action)
   14558             : {
   14559             :     OnCommitItem *oc;
   14560             :     MemoryContext oldcxt;
   14561             : 
   14562             :     /*
   14563             :      * We needn't bother registering the relation unless there is an ON COMMIT
   14564             :      * action we need to take.
   14565             :      */
   14566          40 :     if (action == ONCOMMIT_NOOP || action == ONCOMMIT_PRESERVE_ROWS)
   14567          42 :         return;
   14568             : 
   14569          38 :     oldcxt = MemoryContextSwitchTo(CacheMemoryContext);
   14570             : 
   14571          38 :     oc = (OnCommitItem *) palloc(sizeof(OnCommitItem));
   14572          38 :     oc->relid = relid;
   14573          38 :     oc->oncommit = action;
   14574          38 :     oc->creating_subid = GetCurrentSubTransactionId();
   14575          38 :     oc->deleting_subid = InvalidSubTransactionId;
   14576             : 
   14577             :     /*
   14578             :      * We use lcons() here so that ON COMMIT actions are processed in reverse
   14579             :      * order of registration.  That might not be essential but it seems
   14580             :      * reasonable.
   14581             :      */
   14582          38 :     on_commits = lcons(oc, on_commits);
   14583             : 
   14584          38 :     MemoryContextSwitchTo(oldcxt);
   14585             : }

   14587             : /*
   14588             :  * Unregister any ON COMMIT action when a relation is deleted.
   14589             :  *
   14590             :  * Actually, we only mark the OnCommitItem entry as to be deleted after commit.
   14591             :  */

   14602             :         {
   14603          36 :             oc->deleting_subid = GetCurrentSubTransactionId();
   14604          36 :             break;
   14605             :         }
   14606             :     }

   14608             : 
   14609             : /*
   14610             :  * Perform ON COMMIT actions.
   14611             :  *
   14612             :  * This is invoked just before actually committing, since it's possible
   14613             :  * to encounter errors.
   14614             :  */
   14615             : void
   14616       63060 : PreCommit_on_commit_actions(void)
   14617             : {
   14618             :     ListCell   *l;
   14619       63060 :     List       *oids_to_truncate = NIL;
   14620       63060 :     List       *oids_to_drop = NIL;

   14622       63250 :     foreach(l, on_commits)
   14623             :     {
   14624         190 :         OnCommitItem *oc = (OnCommitItem *) lfirst(l);
   14625             : 
   14626             :         /* Ignore entry if already dropped in this xact */
   14627         190 :         if (oc->deleting_subid != InvalidSubTransactionId)
   14628          18 :             continue;
   14629             :

   14631             :         {
   14632             :             case ONCOMMIT_NOOP:
   14633             :             case ONCOMMIT_PRESERVE_ROWS:
   14634             :                 /* Do nothing (there shouldn't be such entries, actually) */
   14635           0 :                 break;
   14636             :             case ONCOMMIT_DELETE_ROWS:
   14637             : 
   14638             :                 /*
   14639             :                  * If this transaction hasn't accessed any temporary
   14640             :                  * relations, we can skip truncating ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS
   14641             :                  * tables, as they must still be empty.
   14642             :                  */
   14643         158 :                 if ((MyXactFlags & XACT_FLAGS_ACCESSEDTEMPNAMESPACE))
   14644         102 :                     oids_to_truncate = lappend_oid(oids_to_truncate, oc->relid);
   14645         158 :                 break;

   14647          14 :                 oids_to_drop = lappend_oid(oids_to_drop, oc->relid);
   14648          14 :                 break;

   14651             : 
   14652             :     /*
   14653             :      * Truncate relations before dropping so that all dependencies between
   14654             :      * relations are removed after they are worked on.  Doing it like this
   14655             :      * might be a waste as it is possible that a relation being truncated will
   14656             :      * be dropped anyway due to its parent being dropped, but this makes the
   14657             :      * code more robust because of not having to re-check that the relation
   14658             :      * exists at truncation time.
   14659             :      */
   14660       63060 :     if (oids_to_truncate != NIL)

   14706             : 
   14707             : /*
   14708             :  * Post-commit or post-abort cleanup for ON COMMIT management.
   14709             :  *
   14710             :  * All we do here is remove no-longer-needed OnCommitItem entries.
   14711             :  *
   14712             :  * During commit, remove entries that were deleted during this transaction;
   14713             :  * during abort, remove those created during this transaction.
   14714             :  */
   14715             : void
   14716       71316 : AtEOXact_on_commit_actions(bool isCommit)
   14717             : {
   14718             :     ListCell   *cur_item;
   14719             : 
   14720       71512 :     foreach(cur_item, on_commits)
   14721             :     {
   14722         196 :         OnCommitItem *oc = (OnCommitItem *) lfirst(cur_item);
   14723             : 
   14724         226 :         if (isCommit ? oc->deleting_subid != InvalidSubTransactionId :
   14725          30 :             oc->creating_subid != InvalidSubTransactionId)
   14726             :         {
   14727             :             /* cur_item must be removed */
   14728          38 :             on_commits = foreach_delete_current(on_commits, cur_item);
   14729          38 :             pfree(oc);
   14730             :         }
   14731             :         else
   14732             :         {
   14733             :             /* cur_item must be preserved */
   14734         158 :             oc->creating_subid = InvalidSubTransactionId;
   14735         158 :             oc->deleting_subid = InvalidSubTransactionId;
   14736             :         }
   14737             :     }
   14738       71316 : }
   14739             : 
   14740             : /*
   14741             :  * Post-subcommit or post-subabort cleanup for ON COMMIT management.
   14742             :  *
   14743             :  * During subabort, we can immediately remove entries created during this
   14744             :  * subtransaction.  During subcommit, just relabel entries marked during
   14745             :  * this subtransaction as being the parent's responsibility.
   14746             :  */
   14747             : void
   14748        1058 : AtEOSubXact_on_commit_actions(bool isCommit, SubTransactionId mySubid,
   14749             :                               SubTransactionId parentSubid)
   14750             : {
   14751             :     ListCell   *cur_item;
   14752             : 
   14753        1058 :     foreach(cur_item, on_commits)

   14756             : 
   14757           0 :         if (!isCommit && oc->creating_subid == mySubid)
   14758             :         {
   14759             :             /* cur_item must be removed */
   14760           0 :             on_commits = foreach_delete_current(on_commits, cur_item);
   14761           0 :             pfree(oc);
   14762             :         }
   14763             :         else
   14764             :         {
   14765             :             /* cur_item must be preserved */
   14766           0 :             if (oc->creating_subid == mySubid)
   14767           0 :                 oc->creating_subid = parentSubid;
   14768           0 :             if (oc->deleting_subid == mySubid)
   14769           0 :                 oc->deleting_subid = isCommit ? parentSubid : InvalidSubTransactionId;
   14770             :         }
   14771             :     }
   14772        1058 : }
   14773             : 
   14774             : /*
   14775             :  * This is intended as a callback for RangeVarGetRelidExtended().  It allows
   14776             :  * the relation to be locked only if (1) it's a plain table, materialized
   14777             :  * view, or TOAST table and (2) the current user is the owner (or the
   14778             :  * superuser).  This meets the permission-checking needs of CLUSTER, REINDEX
   14779             :  * TABLE, and REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW; we expose it here so that it can be
   14780             :  * used by all.
   14781             :  */
   14782             : void
   14783         112 : RangeVarCallbackOwnsTable(const RangeVar *relation,
   14784             :                           Oid relId, Oid oldRelId, void *arg)
   14785             : {
   14786             :     char        relkind;
   14787             : 
   14788             :     /* Nothing to do if the relation was not found. */
   14789         112 :     if (!OidIsValid(relId))
   14790           0 :         return;
   14791             : 
   14792             :     /*
   14793             :      * If the relation does exist, check whether it's an index.  But note that
   14794             :      * the relation might have been dropped between the time we did the name
   14795             :      * lookup and now.  In that case, there's nothing to do.
   14796             :      */

   14802           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   14803             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),

   14805             :

   14865             : /*
   14866             :  * Common RangeVarGetRelid callback for rename, set schema, and alter table

   14868             :  */
   14869             : static void

   14871             :                                  void *arg)
   14872             : {
   14873        3390 :     Node       *stmt = (Node *) arg;
   14874             :     ObjectType  reltype;

   14880        3390 :     tuple = SearchSysCache1(RELOID, ObjectIdGetDatum(relid));
   14881        3390 :     if (!HeapTupleIsValid(tuple))
   14882        3442 :         return;                 /* concurrently dropped */
   14883        3318 :     classform = (Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   14884        3318 :     relkind = classform->relkind;

   14888          12 :         aclcheck_error(ACLCHECK_NOT_OWNER, get_relkind_objtype(get_rel_relkind(relid)), rv->relname);
   14889             : 
   14890             :     /* No system table modifications unless explicitly allowed. */
   14891        3306 :     if (!allowSystemTableMods && IsSystemClass(relid, classform))
   14892           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   14893             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INSUFFICIENT_PRIVILEGE),
   14894             :                  errmsg("permission denied: \"%s\" is a system catalog",
   14895             :                         rv->relname)));
   14896             : 
   14897             :     /*
   14898             :      * Extract the specified relation type from the statement parse tree.
   14899             :      *

   14922             : 
   14923             :     /*
   14924             :      * For compatibility with prior releases, we allow ALTER TABLE to be used
   14925             :      * with most other types of relations (but not composite types). We allow

   14928             :      * command for the relation at issue.

   14941           0 :         ereport(ERROR,

   14991             : /*
   14992             :  * Transform any expressions present in the partition key
   14993             :  *
   14994             :  * Returns a transformed PartitionSpec, as well as the strategy code
   14995             :  */
   14996             : static PartitionSpec *
   14997         824 : transformPartitionSpec(Relation rel, PartitionSpec *partspec, char *strategy)
   14998             : {
   14999             :     PartitionSpec *newspec;
   15000             :     ParseState *pstate;
   15001             :     RangeTblEntry *rte;
   15002             :     ListCell   *l;
   15003             : 
   15004         824 :     newspec = makeNode(PartitionSpec);
   15005             : 
   15006         824 :     newspec->strategy = partspec->strategy;
   15007         824 :     newspec->partParams = NIL;
   15008         824 :     newspec->location = partspec->location;
   15009             : 
   15010             :     /* Parse partitioning strategy name */
   15011         824 :     if (pg_strcasecmp(partspec->strategy, "hash") == 0)
   15012          34 :         *strategy = PARTITION_STRATEGY_HASH;
   15013         790 :     else if (pg_strcasecmp(partspec->strategy, "list") == 0)
   15014         346 :         *strategy = PARTITION_STRATEGY_LIST;
   15015         444 :     else if (pg_strcasecmp(partspec->strategy, "range") == 0)
   15016         442 :         *strategy = PARTITION_STRATEGY_RANGE;
   15017             :     else
   15018           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15019             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   15020             :                  errmsg("unrecognized partitioning strategy \"%s\"",
   15021             :                         partspec->strategy)));
   15022             : 
   15023             :     /* Check valid number of columns for strategy */
   15024        1168 :     if (*strategy == PARTITION_STRATEGY_LIST &&
   15025         346 :         list_length(partspec->partParams) != 1)
   15026           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15027             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   15028             :                  errmsg("cannot use \"list\" partition strategy with more than one column")));
   15029             : 
   15030             :     /*
   15031             :      * Create a dummy ParseState and insert the target relation as its sole
   15032             :      * rangetable entry.  We need a ParseState for transformExpr.

   15034         820 :     pstate = make_parsestate(NULL);
   15035         820 :     rte = addRangeTableEntryForRelation(pstate, rel, AccessShareLock,
   15036             :                                         NULL, false, true);
   15037         820 :     addRTEtoQuery(pstate, rte, true, true, true);
   15038             : 
   15039             :     /* take care of any partition expressions */
   15040        1734 :     foreach(l, partspec->partParams)
   15041             :     {

   15043             : 
   15044         922 :         if (pelem->expr)
   15045             :         {

   15048             : 
   15049             :             /* Now do parse transformation of the expression */
   15050          82 :             pelem->expr = transformExpr(pstate, pelem->expr,
   15051             :                                         EXPR_KIND_PARTITION_EXPRESSION);

   15053             :             /* we have to fix its collations too */

   15063             : /*
   15064             :  * Compute per-partition-column information from a list of PartitionElems.
   15065             :  * Expressions in the PartitionElems must be parse-analyzed already.
   15066             :  */
   15067             : static void
   15068         812 : ComputePartitionAttrs(ParseState *pstate, Relation rel, List *partParams, AttrNumber *partattrs,
   15069             :                       List **partexprs, Oid *partopclass, Oid *partcollation,
   15070             :                       char strategy)
   15071             : {
   15072             :     int         attn;
   15073             :     ListCell   *lc;
   15074             :     Oid         am_oid;
   15075             : 
   15076         812 :     attn = 0;
   15077        1700 :     foreach(lc, partParams)
   15078             :     {
   15079         914 :         PartitionElem *pelem = castNode(PartitionElem, lfirst(lc));
   15080             :         Oid         atttype;

   15083         914 :         if (pelem->name != NULL)
   15084             :         {

   15092           4 :                 ereport(ERROR,

   15095             :                                 pelem->name),

   15100           2 :                 ereport(ERROR,

   15103             :                                 pelem->name),
   15104             :                          parser_errposition(pstate, pelem->location)));
   15105             : 
   15106             :             /*
   15107             :              * Generated columns cannot work: They are computed after BEFORE
   15108             :              * triggers, but partition routing is done before all triggers.
   15109             :              */
   15110         834 :             if (attform->attgenerated)
   15111           2 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   15112             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),

   15116             :                          parser_errposition(pstate, pelem->location)));
   15117             :

   15124             :         {
   15125             :             /* Expression */
   15126          74 :             Node       *expr = pelem->expr;
   15127             : 
   15128          74 :             Assert(expr != NULL);
   15129          74 :             atttype = exprType(expr);
   15130          74 :             attcollation = exprCollation(expr);
   15131             : 
   15132             :             /*
   15133             :              * Strip any top-level COLLATE clause.  This ensures that we treat
   15134             :              * "x COLLATE y" and "(x COLLATE y)" alike.
   15135             :              */
   15136         148 :             while (IsA(expr, CollateExpr))
   15137           0 :                 expr = (Node *) ((CollateExpr *) expr)->arg;
   15138             : 
   15139          78 :             if (IsA(expr, Var) &&
   15140           4 :                 ((Var *) expr)->varattno > 0)
   15141             :             {
   15142             :                 /*
   15143             :                  * User wrote "(column)" or "(column COLLATE something)".
   15144             :                  * Treat it like simple attribute anyway.
   15145             :                  */
   15146           2 :                 partattrs[attn] = ((Var *) expr)->varattno;
   15147             :             }
   15148             :             else
   15149             :             {
   15150          72 :                 Bitmapset  *expr_attrs = NULL;
   15151             :                 int         i;
   15152             : 
   15153          72 :                 partattrs[attn] = 0;    /* marks the column as expression */
   15154          72 :                 *partexprs = lappend(*partexprs, expr);
   15155             : 
   15156             :                 /*
   15157             :                  * Try to simplify the expression before checking for
   15158             :                  * mutability.  The main practical value of doing it in this
   15159             :                  * order is that an inline-able SQL-language function will be
   15160             :                  * accepted if its expansion is immutable, whether or not the
   15161             :                  * function itself is marked immutable.
   15162             :                  *
   15163             :                  * Note that expression_planner does not change the passed in
   15164             :                  * expression destructively and we have already saved the
   15165             :                  * expression to be stored into the catalog above.
   15166             :                  */
   15167          72 :                 expr = (Node *) expression_planner((Expr *) expr);
   15168             : 
   15169             :                 /*
   15170             :                  * Partition expression cannot contain mutable functions,
   15171             :                  * because a given row must always map to the same partition
   15172             :                  * as long as there is no change in the partition boundary
   15173             :                  * structure.
   15174             :                  */
   15175          72 :                 if (contain_mutable_functions(expr))
   15176           2 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   15177             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   15178             :                              errmsg("functions in partition key expression must be marked IMMUTABLE")));
   15179             : 
   15180             :                 /*
   15181             :                  * transformPartitionSpec() should have already rejected
   15182             :                  * subqueries, aggregates, window functions, and SRFs, based
   15183             :                  * on the EXPR_KIND_ for partition expressions.
   15184             :                  */
   15185             : 
   15186             :                 /*
   15187             :                  * Cannot have expressions containing whole-row references or
   15188             :                  * system column references.
   15189             :                  */
   15190          70 :                 pull_varattnos(expr, 1, &expr_attrs);
   15191          70 :                 if (bms_is_member(0 - FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber,
   15192             :                                   expr_attrs))
   15193           2 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   15194             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   15195             :                              errmsg("partition key expressions cannot contain whole-row references")));
   15196         544 :                 for (i = FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber; i < 0; i++)
   15197             :                 {
   15198         476 :                     if (bms_is_member(i - FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber,
   15199             :                                       expr_attrs))
   15200           0 :                         ereport(ERROR,
   15201             :                                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   15202             :                                  errmsg("partition key expressions cannot contain system column references")));
   15203             :                 }
   15204             : 
   15205             :                 /*
   15206             :                  * Generated columns cannot work: They are computed after
   15207             :                  * BEFORE triggers, but partition routing is done before all
   15208             :                  * triggers.
   15209             :                  */
   15210          68 :                 i = -1;
   15211         214 :                 while ((i = bms_next_member(expr_attrs, i)) >= 0)
   15212             :                 {
   15213          80 :                     AttrNumber  attno = i + FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber;
   15214             : 
   15215          80 :                     if (TupleDescAttr(RelationGetDescr(rel), attno - 1)->attgenerated)
   15216           2 :                         ereport(ERROR,
   15217             :                                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   15218             :                                  errmsg("cannot use generated column in partition key"),
   15219             :                                  errdetail("Column \"%s\" is a generated column.",
   15220             :                                            get_attname(RelationGetRelid(rel), attno, false)),
   15221             :                                  parser_errposition(pstate, pelem->location)));
   15222             :                 }
   15223             : 
   15224             :                 /*
   15225             :                  * While it is not exactly *wrong* for a partition expression
   15226             :                  * to be a constant, it seems better to reject such keys.
   15227             :                  */
   15228          66 :                 if (IsA(expr, Const))
   15229           4 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   15230             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   15231             :                              errmsg("cannot use constant expression as partition key")));
   15232             :             }
   15233             :         }
   15234             : 
   15235             :         /*
   15236             :          * Apply collation override if any
   15237             :          */
   15238         896 :         if (pelem->collation)
   15239          10 :             attcollation = get_collation_oid(pelem->collation, false);
   15240             : 
   15241             :         /*
   15242             :          * Check we have a collation iff it's a collatable type.  The only
   15243             :          * expected failures here are (1) COLLATE applied to a noncollatable
   15244             :          * type, or (2) partition expression had an unresolved collation. But
   15245             :          * we might as well code this to be a complete consistency check.
   15246             :          */
   15247         896 :         if (type_is_collatable(atttype))
   15248             :         {
   15249         124 :             if (!OidIsValid(attcollation))
   15250           0 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   15251             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_INDETERMINATE_COLLATION),
   15252             :                          errmsg("could not determine which collation to use for partition expression"),
   15253             :                          errhint("Use the COLLATE clause to set the collation explicitly.")));
   15254             :         }
   15255             :         else
   15256             :         {
   15257         772 :             if (OidIsValid(attcollation))
   15258           0 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   15259             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   15260             :                          errmsg("collations are not supported by type %s",
   15261             :                                 format_type_be(atttype))));
   15262             :         }
   15263             : 
   15264         896 :         partcollation[attn] = attcollation;
   15265             : 
   15266             :         /*
   15267             :          * Identify the appropriate operator class.  For list and range
   15268             :          * partitioning, we use a btree operator class; hash partitioning uses
   15269             :          * a hash operator class.
   15270             :          */
   15271         896 :         if (strategy == PARTITION_STRATEGY_HASH)
   15272          42 :             am_oid = HASH_AM_OID;
   15273             :         else
   15274         854 :             am_oid = BTREE_AM_OID;
   15275             : 
   15276         896 :         if (!pelem->opclass)
   15277             :         {
   15278         864 :             partopclass[attn] = GetDefaultOpClass(atttype, am_oid);
   15279             : 
   15280         864 :             if (!OidIsValid(partopclass[attn]))

   15283           0 :                     ereport(ERROR,

   15288             :                 else

   15306             : 
   15307             : /*
   15308             :  * PartConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint
   15309             :  *      Do scanrel's existing constraints imply the partition constraint?
   15310             :  *
   15311             :  * "Existing constraints" include its check constraints and column-level
   15312             :  * NOT NULL constraints.  partConstraint describes the partition constraint,
   15313             :  * in implicit-AND form.
   15314             :  */
   15315             : bool
   15316         580 : PartConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(Relation scanrel,
   15317             :                                      List *partConstraint)
   15318             : {
   15319         580 :     List       *existConstraint = NIL;
   15320         580 :     TupleConstr *constr = RelationGetDescr(scanrel)->constr;
   15321             :     int         i;
   15322             : 
   15323         580 :     if (constr && constr->has_not_null)
   15324             :     {
   15325         108 :         int         natts = scanrel->rd_att->natts;
   15326             : 
   15327         356 :         for (i = 1; i <= natts; i++)
   15328             :         {
   15329         248 :             Form_pg_attribute att = TupleDescAttr(scanrel->rd_att, i - 1);
   15330             : 
   15331         248 :             if (att->attnotnull && !att->attisdropped)
   15332             :             {
   15333         160 :                 NullTest   *ntest = makeNode(NullTest);
   15334             : 
   15335         160 :                 ntest->arg = (Expr *) makeVar(1,
   15336             :                                               i,
   15337             :                                               att->atttypid,
   15338             :                                               att->atttypmod,
   15339             :                                               att->attcollation,
   15340             :                                               0);
   15341         160 :                 ntest->nulltesttype = IS_NOT_NULL;
   15342             : 
   15343             :                 /*
   15344             :                  * argisrow=false is correct even for a composite column,
   15345             :                  * because attnotnull does not represent a SQL-spec IS NOT
   15346             :                  * NULL test in such a case, just IS DISTINCT FROM NULL.
   15347             :                  */
   15348         160 :                 ntest->argisrow = false;
   15349         160 :                 ntest->location = -1;
   15350         160 :                 existConstraint = lappend(existConstraint, ntest);
   15351             :             }
   15352             :         }
   15353             :     }
   15354             : 
   15355         580 :     return ConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(scanrel, partConstraint, existConstraint);
   15356             : }
   15357             : 
   15358             : /*
   15359             :  * ConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint
   15360             :  *      Do scanrel's existing constraints imply the given constraint?
   15361             :  *
   15362             :  * testConstraint is the constraint to validate. provenConstraint is a
   15363             :  * caller-provided list of conditions which this function may assume
   15364             :  * to be true. Both provenConstraint and testConstraint must be in
   15365             :  * implicit-AND form, must only contain immutable clauses, and must
   15366             :  * contain only Vars with varno = 1.
   15367             :  */
   15368             : bool
   15369         772 : ConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(Relation scanrel, List *testConstraint, List *provenConstraint)
   15370             : {
   15371         772 :     List       *existConstraint = list_copy(provenConstraint);
   15372         772 :     TupleConstr *constr = RelationGetDescr(scanrel)->constr;
   15373             :     int         num_check,
   15374             :                 i;
   15375             : 
   15376         772 :     num_check = (constr != NULL) ? constr->num_check : 0;
   15377         884 :     for (i = 0; i < num_check; i++)
   15378             :     {
   15379             :         Node       *cexpr;
   15380             : 
   15381             :         /*
   15382             :          * If this constraint hasn't been fully validated yet, we must ignore
   15383             :          * it here.
   15384             :          */
   15385         112 :         if (!constr->check[i].ccvalid)
   15386           2 :             continue;
   15387             : 
   15388         110 :         cexpr = stringToNode(constr->check[i].ccbin);
   15389             : 
   15390             :         /*
   15391             :          * Run each expression through const-simplification and
   15392             :          * canonicalization.  It is necessary, because we will be comparing it
   15393             :          * to similarly-processed partition constraint expressions, and may
   15394             :          * fail to detect valid matches without this.
   15395             :          */
   15396         110 :         cexpr = eval_const_expressions(NULL, cexpr);
   15397         110 :         cexpr = (Node *) canonicalize_qual((Expr *) cexpr, true);
   15398             : 
   15399         110 :         existConstraint = list_concat(existConstraint,
   15400         110 :                                       make_ands_implicit((Expr *) cexpr));
   15401             :     }
   15402             : 
   15403             :     /*
   15404             :      * Try to make the proof.  Since we are comparing CHECK constraints, we
   15405             :      * need to use weak implication, i.e., we assume existConstraint is
   15406             :      * not-false and try to prove the same for testConstraint.
   15407             :      *
   15408             :      * Note that predicate_implied_by assumes its first argument is known
   15409             :      * immutable.  That should always be true for both NOT NULL and partition
   15410             :      * constraints, so we don't test it here.
   15411             :      */
   15412         772 :     return predicate_implied_by(testConstraint, existConstraint, true);
   15413             : }
   15414             : 
   15415             : /*
   15416             :  * QueuePartitionConstraintValidation
   15417             :  *
   15418             :  * Add an entry to wqueue to have the given partition constraint validated by
   15419             :  * Phase 3, for the given relation, and all its children.
   15420             :  *
   15421             :  * We first verify whether the given constraint is implied by pre-existing
   15422             :  * relation constraints; if it is, there's no need to scan the table to
   15423             :  * validate, so don't queue in that case.
   15424             :  */
   15425             : static void
   15426         430 : QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(List **wqueue, Relation scanrel,
   15427             :                                    List *partConstraint,
   15428             :                                    bool validate_default)
   15429             : {
   15430             :     /*
   15431             :      * Based on the table's existing constraints, determine whether or not we
   15432             :      * may skip scanning the table.
   15433             :      */
   15434         430 :     if (PartConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(scanrel, partConstraint))
   15435             :     {
   15436          22 :         if (!validate_default)
   15437          16 :             ereport(DEBUG1,
   15438             :                     (errmsg("partition constraint for table \"%s\" is implied by existing constraints",
   15439             :                             RelationGetRelationName(scanrel))));
   15440             :         else
   15441           6 :             ereport(DEBUG1,
   15442             :                     (errmsg("updated partition constraint for default partition \"%s\" is implied by existing constraints",
   15443             :                             RelationGetRelationName(scanrel))));
   15444         452 :         return;
   15445             :     }
   15446             : 
   15447             :     /*
   15448             :      * Constraints proved insufficient. For plain relations, queue a
   15449             :      * validation item now; for partitioned tables, recurse to process each
   15450             :      * partition.
   15451             :      */
   15452         408 :     if (scanrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_RELATION)
   15453             :     {
   15454             :         AlteredTableInfo *tab;
   15455             : 
   15456             :         /* Grab a work queue entry. */
   15457         328 :         tab = ATGetQueueEntry(wqueue, scanrel);
   15458         328 :         Assert(tab->partition_constraint == NULL);
   15459         328 :         tab->partition_constraint = (Expr *) linitial(partConstraint);
   15460         328 :         tab->validate_default = validate_default;
   15461             :     }
   15462          80 :     else if (scanrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   15463             :     {
   15464          70 :         PartitionDesc partdesc = RelationGetPartitionDesc(scanrel);
   15465             :         int         i;
   15466             : 
   15467         168 :         for (i = 0; i < partdesc->nparts; i++)
   15468             :         {
   15469             :             Relation    part_rel;
   15470             :             bool        found_whole_row;
   15471             :             List       *thisPartConstraint;
   15472             : 
   15473             :             /*
   15474             :              * This is the minimum lock we need to prevent deadlocks.
   15475             :              */
   15476          98 :             part_rel = table_open(partdesc->oids[i], AccessExclusiveLock);
   15477             : 
   15478             :             /*
   15479             :              * Adjust the constraint for scanrel so that it matches this
   15480             :              * partition's attribute numbers.
   15481             :              */
   15482          98 :             thisPartConstraint =
   15483             :                 map_partition_varattnos(partConstraint, 1,
   15484             :                                         part_rel, scanrel, &found_whole_row);
   15485             :             /* There can never be a whole-row reference here */
   15486          98 :             if (found_whole_row)
   15487           0 :                 elog(ERROR, "unexpected whole-row reference found in partition constraint");
   15488             : 
   15489          98 :             QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(wqueue, part_rel,
   15490             :                                                thisPartConstraint,
   15491             :                                                validate_default);
   15492          98 :             table_close(part_rel, NoLock);  /* keep lock till commit */
   15493             :         }
   15494             :     }
   15495             : }
   15496             : 
   15497             : /*
   15498             :  * ALTER TABLE <name> ATTACH PARTITION <partition-name> FOR VALUES
   15499             :  *
   15500             :  * Return the address of the newly attached partition.
   15501             :  */
   15502             : static ObjectAddress
   15503         368 : ATExecAttachPartition(List **wqueue, Relation rel, PartitionCmd *cmd)
   15504             : {
   15505             :     Relation    attachrel,
   15506             :                 catalog;
   15507             :     List       *attachrel_children;
   15508             :     List       *partConstraint;
   15509             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   15510             :     ScanKeyData skey;
   15511             :     AttrNumber  attno;
   15512             :     int         natts;
   15513             :     TupleDesc   tupleDesc;
   15514             :     ObjectAddress address;
   15515             :     const char *trigger_name;
   15516             :     bool        found_whole_row;
   15517             :     Oid         defaultPartOid;
   15518             :     List       *partBoundConstraint;
   15519             : 
   15520             :     /*
   15521             :      * We must lock the default partition if one exists, because attaching a
   15522             :      * new partition will change its partition constraint.
   15523             :      */
   15524         368 :     defaultPartOid =
   15525         368 :         get_default_oid_from_partdesc(RelationGetPartitionDesc(rel));
   15526         368 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   15527          46 :         LockRelationOid(defaultPartOid, AccessExclusiveLock);
   15528             : 
   15529         368 :     attachrel = table_openrv(cmd->name, AccessExclusiveLock);
   15530             : 
   15531             :     /*
   15532             :      * XXX I think it'd be a good idea to grab locks on all tables referenced
   15533             :      * by FKs at this point also.
   15534             :      */
   15535             : 
   15536             :     /*
   15537             :      * Must be owner of both parent and source table -- parent was checked by
   15538             :      * ATSimplePermissions call in ATPrepCmd
   15539             :      */
   15540         366 :     ATSimplePermissions(attachrel, ATT_TABLE | ATT_FOREIGN_TABLE);
   15541             : 
   15542             :     /* A partition can only have one parent */
   15543         364 :     if (attachrel->rd_rel->relispartition)
   15544           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15545             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15546             :                  errmsg("\"%s\" is already a partition",
   15547             :                         RelationGetRelationName(attachrel))));
   15548             : 
   15549         362 :     if (OidIsValid(attachrel->rd_rel->reloftype))
   15550           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15551             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15552             :                  errmsg("cannot attach a typed table as partition")));
   15553             : 
   15554             :     /*
   15555             :      * Table being attached should not already be part of inheritance; either
   15556             :      * as a child table...
   15557             :      */
   15558         360 :     catalog = table_open(InheritsRelationId, AccessShareLock);
   15559         360 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey,

   15566           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15567             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15568             :                  errmsg("cannot attach inheritance child as partition")));
   15569         358 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   15570             : 
   15571             :     /* ...or as a parent table (except the case when it is partitioned) */
   15572         358 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey,
   15573             :                 Anum_pg_inherits_inhparent,
   15574             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   15575         358 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(attachrel)));
   15576         358 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalog, InheritsParentIndexId, true, NULL,
   15577             :                               1, &skey);
   15578         420 :     if (HeapTupleIsValid(systable_getnext(scan)) &&
   15579          62 :         attachrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_RELATION)
   15580           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15581             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15582             :                  errmsg("cannot attach inheritance parent as partition")));
   15583         356 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   15584         356 :     table_close(catalog, AccessShareLock);
   15585             : 
   15586             :     /*
   15587             :      * Prevent circularity by seeing if rel is a partition of attachrel. (In
   15588             :      * particular, this disallows making a rel a partition of itself.)
   15589             :      *
   15590             :      * We do that by checking if rel is a member of the list of attachrel's
   15591             :      * partitions provided the latter is partitioned at all.  We want to avoid
   15592             :      * having to construct this list again, so we request the strongest lock
   15593             :      * on all partitions.  We need the strongest lock, because we may decide
   15594             :      * to scan them if we find out that the table being attached (or its leaf
   15595             :      * partitions) may contain rows that violate the partition constraint. If
   15596             :      * the table has a constraint that would prevent such rows, which by
   15597             :      * definition is present in all the partitions, we need not scan the
   15598             :      * table, nor its partitions.  But we cannot risk a deadlock by taking a
   15599             :      * weaker lock now and the stronger one only when needed.
   15600             :      */
   15601         356 :     attachrel_children = find_all_inheritors(RelationGetRelid(attachrel),
   15602             :                                              AccessExclusiveLock, NULL);
   15603         356 :     if (list_member_oid(attachrel_children, RelationGetRelid(rel)))
   15604           4 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15605             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_DUPLICATE_TABLE),
   15606             :                  errmsg("circular inheritance not allowed"),
   15607             :                  errdetail("\"%s\" is already a child of \"%s\".",
   15608             :                            RelationGetRelationName(rel),
   15609             :                            RelationGetRelationName(attachrel))));
   15610             : 
   15611             :     /* If the parent is permanent, so must be all of its partitions. */
   15612         696 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence != RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   15613         344 :         attachrel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP)
   15614           2 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15615             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15616             :                  errmsg("cannot attach a temporary relation as partition of permanent relation \"%s\"",
   15617             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel))));
   15618             : 
   15619             :     /* Temp parent cannot have a partition that is itself not a temp */
   15620         358 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   15621           8 :         attachrel->rd_rel->relpersistence != RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP)
   15622           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   15623             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15624             :                  errmsg("cannot attach a permanent relation as partition of temporary relation \"%s\"",

   15627             :     /* If the parent is temp, it must belong to this session */

   15661             :                             RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   15662             :                      errdetail("The new partition may contain only the columns present in parent.")));

   15664             : 
   15665             :     /*
   15666             :      * If child_rel has row-level triggers with transition tables, we
   15667             :      * currently don't allow it to become a partition.  See also prohibitions

   15742             :     }
   15743             : 
   15744             :     /*
   15745             :      * If we're attaching a partition other than the default partition and a
   15746             :      * default one exists, then that partition's partition constraint changes,
   15747             :      * so add an entry to the work queue to validate it, too.  (We must not do
   15748             :      * this when the partition being attached is the default one; we already
   15749             :      * did it above!)
   15750             :      */
   15751         302 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   15752             :     {
   15753             :         Relation    defaultrel;
   15754             :         List       *defPartConstraint;
   15755             : 
   15756          36 :         Assert(!cmd->bound->is_default);
   15757             : 
   15758             :         /* we already hold a lock on the default partition */
   15759          36 :         defaultrel = table_open(defaultPartOid, NoLock);
   15760          36 :         defPartConstraint =
   15761             :             get_proposed_default_constraint(partBoundConstraint);
   15762             : 
   15763             :         /*
   15764             :          * Map the Vars in the constraint expression from rel's attnos to
   15765             :          * defaultrel's.
   15766             :          */
   15767          36 :         defPartConstraint =
   15768             :             map_partition_varattnos(defPartConstraint,
   15769             :                                     1, defaultrel, rel, NULL);
   15770          36 :         QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(wqueue, defaultrel,
   15771             :                                            defPartConstraint, true);
   15772             : 
   15773             :         /* keep our lock until commit. */
   15774          36 :         table_close(defaultrel, NoLock);
   15775             :     }
   15776             : 
   15777         302 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId, RelationGetRelid(attachrel));
   15778             : 
   15779             :     /* keep our lock until commit */
   15780         302 :     table_close(attachrel, NoLock);
   15781             : 
   15782         302 :     return address;
   15783             : }
   15784             : 
   15785             : /*
   15786             :  * AttachPartitionEnsureIndexes
   15787             :  *      subroutine for ATExecAttachPartition to create/match indexes
   15788             :  *
   15789             :  * Enforce the indexing rule for partitioned tables during ALTER TABLE / ATTACH
   15790             :  * PARTITION: every partition must have an index attached to each index on the
   15791             :  * partitioned table.
   15792             :  */
   15793             : static void
   15794         312 : AttachPartitionEnsureIndexes(Relation rel, Relation attachrel)
   15795             : {
   15796             :     List       *idxes;
   15797             :     List       *attachRelIdxs;
   15798             :     Relation   *attachrelIdxRels;
   15799             :     IndexInfo **attachInfos;
   15800             :     int         i;
   15801             :     ListCell   *cell;
   15802             :     MemoryContext cxt;
   15803             :     MemoryContext oldcxt;
   15804             : 
   15805         312 :     cxt = AllocSetContextCreate(CurrentMemoryContext,
   15806             :                                 "AttachPartitionEnsureIndexes",
   15807             :                                 ALLOCSET_DEFAULT_SIZES);
   15808         312 :     oldcxt = MemoryContextSwitchTo(cxt);
   15809             : 
   15810         312 :     idxes = RelationGetIndexList(rel);
   15811         312 :     attachRelIdxs = RelationGetIndexList(attachrel);
   15812         312 :     attachrelIdxRels = palloc(sizeof(Relation) * list_length(attachRelIdxs));
   15813         312 :     attachInfos = palloc(sizeof(IndexInfo *) * list_length(attachRelIdxs));
   15814             : 
   15815             :     /* Build arrays of all existing indexes and their IndexInfos */
   15816         312 :     i = 0;
   15817         376 :     foreach(cell, attachRelIdxs)
   15818             :     {
   15819          64 :         Oid         cldIdxId = lfirst_oid(cell);
   15820             : 
   15821          64 :         attachrelIdxRels[i] = index_open(cldIdxId, AccessShareLock);
   15822          64 :         attachInfos[i] = BuildIndexInfo(attachrelIdxRels[i]);
   15823          64 :         i++;
   15824             :     }
   15825             : 
   15826             :     /*
   15827             :      * If we're attaching a foreign table, we must fail if any of the indexes
   15828             :      * is a constraint index; otherwise, there's nothing to do here.  Do this
   15829             :      * before starting work, to avoid wasting the effort of building a few
   15830             :      * non-unique indexes before coming across a unique one.
   15831             :      */
   15832         312 :     if (attachrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_FOREIGN_TABLE)
   15833             :     {
   15834          22 :         foreach(cell, idxes)
   15835             :         {
   15836          12 :             Oid         idx = lfirst_oid(cell);
   15837          12 :             Relation    idxRel = index_open(idx, AccessShareLock);
   15838             : 
   15839          20 :             if (idxRel->rd_index->indisunique ||
   15840           8 :                 idxRel->rd_index->indisprimary)
   15841           4 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   15842             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   15843             :                          errmsg("cannot attach foreign table \"%s\" as partition of partitioned table \"%s\"",
   15844             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(attachrel),
   15845             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   15846             :                          errdetail("Table \"%s\" contains unique indexes.",
   15847             :                                    RelationGetRelationName(rel))));
   15848           8 :             index_close(idxRel, AccessShareLock);
   15849             :         }
   15850             : 
   15851          10 :         goto out;
   15852             :     }
   15853             : 
   15854             :     /*
   15855             :      * For each index on the partitioned table, find a matching one in the
   15856             :      * partition-to-be; if one is not found, create one.
   15857             :      */
   15858         372 :     foreach(cell, idxes)
   15859             :     {
   15860          80 :         Oid         idx = lfirst_oid(cell);
   15861          80 :         Relation    idxRel = index_open(idx, AccessShareLock);
   15862             :         IndexInfo  *info;
   15863             :         AttrNumber *attmap;
   15864          80 :         bool        found = false;

   15868             :          * Ignore indexes in the partitioned table other than partitioned
   15869             :          * indexes.
   15870             :          */
   15871          80 :         if (idxRel->rd_rel->relkind != RELKIND_PARTITIONED_INDEX)
   15872             :         {
   15873           0 :             index_close(idxRel, AccessShareLock);
   15874           0 :             continue;
   15875             :         }
   15876             : 
   15877             :         /* construct an indexinfo to compare existing indexes against */
   15878          80 :         info = BuildIndexInfo(idxRel);
   15879          80 :         attmap = convert_tuples_by_name_map(RelationGetDescr(attachrel),
   15880             :                                             RelationGetDescr(rel));
   15881          80 :         constraintOid = get_relation_idx_constraint_oid(RelationGetRelid(rel), idx);
   15882             : 
   15883             :         /*
   15884             :          * Scan the list of existing indexes in the partition-to-be, and mark
   15885             :          * the first matching, unattached one we find, if any, as partition of
   15886             :          * the parent index.  If we find one, we're done.
   15887             :          */
   15888          98 :         for (i = 0; i < list_length(attachRelIdxs); i++)
   15889             :         {
   15890          40 :             Oid         cldIdxId = RelationGetRelid(attachrelIdxRels[i]);
   15891          40 :             Oid         cldConstrOid = InvalidOid;
   15892             : 
   15893             :             /* does this index have a parent?  if so, can't use it */
   15894          40 :             if (attachrelIdxRels[i]->rd_rel->relispartition)
   15895           4 :                 continue;
   15896             : 
   15897         108 :             if (CompareIndexInfo(attachInfos[i], info,
   15898          36 :                                  attachrelIdxRels[i]->rd_indcollation,
   15899             :                                  idxRel->rd_indcollation,

   15901             :                                  idxRel->rd_opfamily,
   15902             :                                  attmap,
   15903          36 :                                  RelationGetDescr(rel)->natts))
   15904             :             {
   15905             :                 /*
   15906             :                  * If this index is being created in the parent because of a
   15907             :                  * constraint, then the child needs to have a constraint also,
   15908             :                  * so look for one.  If there is no such constraint, this
   15909             :                  * index is no good, so keep looking.
   15910             :                  */

   15912             :                 {
   15913           4 :                     cldConstrOid =
   15914           4 :                         get_relation_idx_constraint_oid(RelationGetRelid(attachrel),
   15915             :                                                         cldIdxId);

   15927             :

   15932             : 
   15933             :         /*
   15934             :          * If no suitable index was found in the partition-to-be, create one

   15949             :                         true, false, false, false, false);
   15950             :         }
   15951             : 
   15952          74 :         index_close(idxRel, AccessShareLock);

   15954             : 
   15955             : out:
   15956             :     /* Clean up. */
   15957         362 :     for (i = 0; i < list_length(attachRelIdxs); i++)

   15963             : /*
   15964             :  * CloneRowTriggersToPartition

   15969         316 : CloneRowTriggersToPartition(Relation parent, Relation partition)
   15970             : {

   16110             : /*
   16111             :  * ALTER TABLE DETACH PARTITION
   16112             :  *
   16113             :  * Return the address of the relation that is no longer a partition of rel.
   16114             :  */
   16115             : static ObjectAddress
   16116          80 : ATExecDetachPartition(Relation rel, RangeVar *name)
   16117             : {
   16118             :     Relation    partRel,
   16119             :                 classRel;
   16120             :     HeapTuple   tuple,
   16121             :                 newtuple;
   16122             :     Datum       new_val[Natts_pg_class];
   16123             :     bool        new_null[Natts_pg_class],
   16124             :                 new_repl[Natts_pg_class];
   16125             :     ObjectAddress address;
   16126             :     Oid         defaultPartOid;
   16127             :     List       *indexes;
   16128             :     List       *fks;
   16129             :     ListCell   *cell;
   16130             : 
   16131             :     /*
   16132             :      * We must lock the default partition, because detaching this partition
   16133             :      * will change its partition constraint.
   16134             :      */
   16135          80 :     defaultPartOid =
   16136          80 :         get_default_oid_from_partdesc(RelationGetPartitionDesc(rel));
   16137          80 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   16138          30 :         LockRelationOid(defaultPartOid, AccessExclusiveLock);
   16139             : 
   16140          80 :     partRel = table_openrv(name, ShareUpdateExclusiveLock);
   16141             : 
   16142             :     /* Ensure that foreign keys still hold after this detach */
   16143          76 :     ATDetachCheckNoForeignKeyRefs(partRel);
   16144             : 
   16145             :     /* All inheritance related checks are performed within the function */
   16146          66 :     RemoveInheritance(partRel, rel);
   16147             : 
   16148             :     /* Update pg_class tuple */
   16149          60 :     classRel = table_open(RelationRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   16150          60 :     tuple = SearchSysCacheCopy1(RELOID,
   16151             :                                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(partRel)));
   16152          60 :     if (!HeapTupleIsValid(tuple))
   16153           0 :         elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for relation %u",
   16154             :              RelationGetRelid(partRel));
   16155          60 :     Assert(((Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(tuple))->relispartition);
   16156             : 
   16157             :     /* Clear relpartbound and reset relispartition */
   16158          60 :     memset(new_val, 0, sizeof(new_val));
   16159          60 :     memset(new_null, false, sizeof(new_null));
   16160          60 :     memset(new_repl, false, sizeof(new_repl));
   16161          60 :     new_val[Anum_pg_class_relpartbound - 1] = (Datum) 0;
   16162          60 :     new_null[Anum_pg_class_relpartbound - 1] = true;
   16163          60 :     new_repl[Anum_pg_class_relpartbound - 1] = true;
   16164          60 :     newtuple = heap_modify_tuple(tuple, RelationGetDescr(classRel),
   16165             :                                  new_val, new_null, new_repl);
   16166             : 
   16167          60 :     ((Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(newtuple))->relispartition = false;
   16168          60 :     CatalogTupleUpdate(classRel, &newtuple->t_self, newtuple);
   16169          60 :     heap_freetuple(newtuple);
   16170             : 
   16171          60 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   16172             :     {
   16173             :         /*
   16174             :          * If the relation being detached is the default partition itself,
   16175             :          * remove it from the parent's pg_partitioned_table entry.
   16176             :          *
   16177             :          * If not, we must invalidate default partition's relcache entry, as
   16178             :          * in StorePartitionBound: its partition constraint depends on every
   16179             :          * other partition's partition constraint.
   16180             :          */

   16182           2 :             update_default_partition_oid(RelationGetRelid(rel), InvalidOid);

   16186             : 
   16187             :     /* detach indexes too */

   16193             :         Oid         constrOid;

   16196           6 :             continue;

   16198          20 :         Assert((IndexGetRelation(get_partition_parent(idxid), false) ==
   16199             :                 RelationGetRelid(rel)));

   16202          20 :         IndexSetParentIndex(idx, InvalidOid);

   16211             :     }
   16212          60 :     table_close(classRel, RowExclusiveLock);
   16213             : 
   16214             :     /*
   16215             :      * Detach any foreign keys that are inherited.  This includes creating
   16216             :      * additional action triggers.
   16217             :      */
   16218          60 :     fks = copyObject(RelationGetFKeyList(partRel));
   16219          82 :     foreach(cell, fks)
   16220             :     {
   16221          22 :         ForeignKeyCacheInfo *fk = lfirst(cell);
   16222             :         HeapTuple   contup;

   16231             :         /* consider only the inherited foreign keys */
   16232          44 :         if (conform->contype != CONSTRAINT_FOREIGN ||
   16233          22 :             !OidIsValid(conform->conparentid))
   16234             :         {
   16235           6 :             ReleaseSysCache(contup);
   16236           6 :             continue;
   16237             :         }
   16238             : 
   16239             :         /* unset conparentid and adjust conislocal, coninhcount, etc. */
   16240          16 :         ConstraintSetParentConstraint(fk->conoid, InvalidOid, InvalidOid);
   16241             :

   16244             :          * a partition the action triggers pointed to the parent rel (they

   16250          16 :         fkconstraint->fk_del_action = conform->confdeltype;

   16298             : /*
   16299             :  * Before acquiring lock on an index, acquire the same lock on the owning
   16300             :  * table.
   16301             :  */

   16309             : static void
   16310          72 : RangeVarCallbackForAttachIndex(const RangeVar *rv, Oid relOid, Oid oldRelOid,

   16322          68 :         state->lockedParentTbl = true;

   16325             :     /*

   16360             : /*
   16361             :  * ALTER INDEX i1 ATTACH PARTITION i2
   16362             :  */
   16363             : static ObjectAddress
   16364          68 : ATExecAttachPartitionIdx(List **wqueue, Relation parentIdx, RangeVar *name)
   16365             : {
   16366             :     Relation    partIdx;
   16367             :     Relation    partTbl;
   16368             :     Relation    parentTbl;
   16369             :     ObjectAddress address;
   16370             :     Oid         partIdxId;
   16371             :     Oid         currParent;
   16372             :     struct AttachIndexCallbackState state;
   16373             : 
   16374             :     /*
   16375             :      * We need to obtain lock on the index 'name' to modify it, but we also
   16376             :      * need to read its owning table's tuple descriptor -- so we need to lock
   16377             :      * both.  To avoid deadlocks, obtain lock on the table before doing so on
   16378             :      * the index.  Furthermore, we need to examine the parent table of the
   16379             :      * partition, so lock that one too.
   16380             :      */
   16381          68 :     state.partitionOid = InvalidOid;
   16382          68 :     state.parentTblOid = parentIdx->rd_index->indrelid;
   16383          68 :     state.lockedParentTbl = false;

   16394             :     /* no deadlock risk: RangeVarGetRelidExtended already acquired the lock */

   16534             : /*
   16535             :  * Verify whether the set of attached partition indexes to a parent index on
   16536             :  * a partitioned table is complete.  If it is, mark the parent index valid.
   16537             :  *
   16538             :  * This should be called each time a partition index is attached.
   16539             :  */
   16540             : static void
   16541          50 : validatePartitionedIndex(Relation partedIdx, Relation partedTbl)
   16542             : {
   16543             :     Relation    inheritsRel;
   16544             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   16545             :     ScanKeyData key;
   16546          50 :     int         tuples = 0;
   16547             :     HeapTuple   inhTup;
   16548          50 :     bool        updated = false;
   16549             : 
   16550          50 :     Assert(partedIdx->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_INDEX);
   16551             : 
   16552             :     /*
   16553             :      * Scan pg_inherits for this parent index.  Count each valid index we find
   16554             :      * (verifying the pg_index entry for each), and if we reach the total
   16555             :      * amount we expect, we can mark this parent index as valid.
   16556             :      */

   16558          50 :     ScanKeyInit(&key, Anum_pg_inherits_inhparent,
   16559             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   16560          50 :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(partedIdx)));

   16562             :                               NULL, 1, &key);

   16577             :     }
   16578             : 
   16579             :     /* Done with pg_inherits */

   16583             :     /*

   16630             : /*
   16631             :  * Return an OID list of constraints that reference the given relation

   16634             : static List *
   16635         136 : GetParentedForeignKeyRefs(Relation partition)
   16636             : {
   16637             :     Relation    pg_constraint;
   16638             :     HeapTuple   tuple;

   16642             : 
   16643             :     /*
   16644             :      * If no indexes, or no columns are referenceable by FKs, we can avoid the

   16648          62 :         bms_is_empty(RelationGetIndexAttrBitmap(partition,

   16682             : /*
   16683             :  * During DETACH PARTITION, verify that any foreign keys pointing to the
   16684             :  * partitioned table would not become invalid.  An error is raised if any
   16685             :  * referenced values exist.
   16686             :  */
   16687             : static void
   16688          76 : ATDetachCheckNoForeignKeyRefs(Relation partition)
   16689             : {
   16690             :     List       *constraints;
   16691             :     ListCell   *cell;
   16692             : 
   16693          76 :     constraints = GetParentedForeignKeyRefs(partition);
   16694             : 
   16695          78 :     foreach(cell, constraints)
   16696             :     {
   16697          12 :         Oid         constrOid = lfirst_oid(cell);
   16698             :         HeapTuple   tuple;
   16699             :         Form_pg_constraint constrForm;

   16702             : 
   16703          12 :         tuple = SearchSysCache1(CONSTROID, ObjectIdGetDatum(constrOid));

   16705           0 :             elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for constraint %u", constrOid);
   16706          12 :         constrForm = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(tuple);

   16710             :

   16714          12 :         MemSet(&trig, 0, sizeof(trig));
   16715          12 :         trig.tgoid = InvalidOid;
